The room was adequate, but on this occasion very peaceful. On out second stay, we were allocated a much handier room (131), ground floor with a very nice patio looking out on to the pool. Better still, we thought. But unfortunately the noise pollution was pretty bad. We are generally good sleepers, but even we found it difficult in this room. It had a large patio sliding door, but single glazed and so we heard every sound. However, compare then the free wi-fi, free airport shuttle (who will also take you to the car hire depots), included very creditable breakfast, location for the airport, nice pool, and friendly helpful staff. So on balance it gets a cautious thumbs up from me, just so long as your expectations are not unrealistic. Certainly good value for money, just expect the rough with the smooth.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, but all comforts”
Reviews.Author: Dawncg
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel directly from the glitz of las Vegas, and initially was disapionted by the tired looking rooms. Then the reception staff proved to be more than helpful, I discovered the generous tea & coffee facilities (not provided in Vegas) . The patio door lead to a small but relaxing pool, and the wifi was free ($14.00 per day in Vegas) so now my opinion was picking up at speed!! Breakfast was included in the (very low) room rate and I must say it was a decent breakfast too, with coffee, herbal teas, fresh fruit and cereals and assorted pastries. We checked out at 10.00am but were not flying until 10 pm, but the staff looked after our luggage and kindly allowed us to wait in the reception area for an hour before our departure. What great value this was for such a low rate, (the courtesy airport shuttle is included) and although the room decor wont ever win any awards, the comfort, amenities and friendliness of staff made this a great little place to spend the last night before our flight home.

Reviews.Title: “Best value close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: cynlew
Reviews.Content: Value was great for a good nights sleep and a short distance from LAX. By no means is it a 3, 4 , or 5 star hotel. I thought I had travelled back in time to 1970, as it was very outdated! However, the room was clean, the staff was friendly, and and the beds were comfortable.Just what we needed after a long flight from China. Having the Denny's next door was a plus when we'd had nothing but Chinese food for 2 weeks!! All in all a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall hotel and value. Close to airport, beaches.”
Reviews.Author: Soulsurfer3
Reviews.Content: Overall it's a great hotel and value, there's not much of interest nearby besides the airport; but it's 10 minutes from Manhattan and other beaches. There's a clean pool and each room has either a balcony or deck to the courtyard. The rooms are clean and relatively spacious. TV's are on the small side, but they have wireless internet. Overall, not a luxurious hotel, but it's only $70/night. For that it's an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Alright for a 1 night stay close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: 5KiwisinOz
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel before we flew out and it's location is great for the airport. Although the hotel appears dated the rooms are clean and tidy and the staff were friendly enough. The pool was great for our family to relax in before our flight out and there was a Denny's right next door which was nice enough for a quick meal. Breakfast was OK as well. Car hire drop off places were only 1 km up the road and the hotel was happy enough to pick me up but as it was close enough I just walked back to the hotel. Although the hotel is located close to the airport the noise wasn't too bad at night.

Reviews.Title: “spot on”
Reviews.Author: James-Turnbull
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel at the start and end of our road trip from L.A to vegas to san francisco, check in went quickly enough although they could have been quicker when i went back round because our room keys didnt work. Rooms were clean and the beds were comfy, breakfast was fine if your after something quick although we had breakfast in dennys which was pretty good. We drove into downtown L.A on the first day, half an hour took us in, traffic wasn't too bad, recommend the city sightseeing tour we got it for 20 dollars each and it lets you c pretty much all there is to see in about 1 and a half/ 2hours. We drove to six flags the second day bout 45 mins away it was a good day out also. overall this hotel is perfect if your looking for a place to get your head down, seen a few complaints about aircraft noise, me personally, didnt hear a thing!

Reviews.Title: “close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Chris7542
Reviews.Content: our room was damp, but clean breakfast was good enough very close to the rentalcars, so perfect for a first night stay Dennys on the corner is 24 hr open

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Dublin3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really great value when all you are looking for is a place to sleep. I read many of the reviews for the hotel, and while most were positive some were not very encouraging. Sure, the place is not as snazzy as the bigger, newer hotels at LAX, but it is clean, the wifi and parking are free, and the staff are pleasent. Plus, the Denny's next door is perfect! In response to other reviewers that complained about aircraft noise; it is an airport hotel so planes will be landing until after midnight and you will hear them no matter which hotel you stay in. But really, the noise is not that bad, and if you are tired you won't even notice them.

Reviews.Title: “Better Inside Than Out”
Reviews.Author: dewdawg
Reviews.Content: We chose this place because we were driving all night from Arizona to pick up two cats that were being shipped from Libya to LAX (the airports at Tucson and Phoenix had embargoed live animals because of the heat). From my research beforehand, it seemed that only the La Quinta or the Travelodge would accept CATS. Many places said they were "pet-friendly," but that really means only DOGS. Now, I have two doggies I love, but these other places were CATISTS! Anywho, the Travelodge looks a little down-at-heel from the outside and is a maze of rooms and pathways and the parking is atrocious( but free!). We were assigned a pet-specific room, which had me quaking in my boots as we opened the door, but the interior of the room is perfectly fine. The floors are tile, which is fine by me. We all know animals are not so careful sometimes. And the furniture is rather bulletproof - again, fine when you have cats. The bathroom is large and fairly recently updated, the bed is OK and the room is CLEAN. There's a big table, two desk chairs and another sort of club chair. The room is fairly, happily spacious, there's a decent TV, and FREE wi-fi. We also arrived at 10 a.m. and were allowed to check in right away, which we dearly appreciated, since the noon arrival for the cats turned into a 3:30 ETA. We are now tucked in with two very happy cats, who still have a few more hours in their crates before they are truly and well shut of Moammar Ghadfi. But we are comfortable and looking forward to a good night's sleep. I wouldn't make the Travelodge my first, or even, second choice, but for those with pets, it's great!

Reviews.Title: “just right for the price”
Reviews.Author: SL27
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a day in december 2010 en route to Dubai.We had done quite a lot of travelling and wanted to rest a few hours before our long flight. We reached rather late in the night and it was raining away and were put up in a room which was on the first floor.As we had a small child, we requested for a different room and the lady at the reception was so nice that she gave us a room which was huge and on the ground floor- I think they were full up and this must have been a suite. we were very happy. Breakfast closes early so we missed that but there is a Dennys next door which is convenient. There is also a hotel airport shuttle which is free. We had to leave in the morning shortly so cant comment on other services, but I did see a pool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: lynp
Reviews.Content: WE stayed for 2 nights and was so impressed we are going back to stay for 6 nights at the end of our USA trip. The rooms are lovely, quite large with big balconies. Lovely furniture, great TV, excellent bathroom with complimentary toiletries. Great coffee machine. The staff are very nice and helpful. Breakfast is good, lovely gardens and a pool which was most appreciated as it was hot when we stayed. Denny's next door is great. Shuttle was quick. I couldn't find fault with anything. We have travelled a great deal and being a senior Australian couple are very fussy and picky about where we stay, and this hotel is on our will stay again list. Thanks Travelodge for an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: dickyboy26
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 and half days on way to jan and way back april 2011 . it is retro 60's as managmentstates. Very confortable but remember the timing on the shuttle. On arrival shuttlle took only 15 minutes on return more like 40 minutes. early morning rush hour. heh! for a retired couple with patience - the price is right ' took the $5 return bus down to Manhattan beach - had o great meal at the brewery restaurant- walk the beach -had a good breakfast- staff was great- certainly we will return - but it's not to everyones liking- staff were great. simming pool great an free wifi. What do you want?

Reviews.Title: “Good place for a stop over”
Reviews.Author: Gitfire
Reviews.Content: Free bus from LAX every half hour. Efficient and welcoming reception staff. Room was fine, clean and bed comfortable. Denney's, Taco Bell and MacDonalds close by. Check in and out was generous and meant we had 24 hours between flights. Baggage was stored free while we went out for lunch. Yes there are planes going over but it's an airport hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Dont Go.”
Reviews.Author: valdigstad
Reviews.Content: Frommers recommended this hotel. I wouldnt. Although close to LAX and the car rentals, and it has a 24 hr Denny's, the hotel is in very poor condition. The walk to our room through a dark corridor, through an even darker courtyard, up unlit stairs, was scary! The room was terrible, and the noise from the traffic was worse than from the planes. The pool area looked OK, the price was cheap, but we got what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Service beyond my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: annadair
Reviews.Content: I had an unexpected layover when my son became sick on a plane. After searching for an affordable hotel for the night, I found this hotel on the hotel board in LAX baggage claim and had never stayed at a travelodge before. I was aprehensive since I am used to HIltons or Marriots, but I must say the reservationist was very helpful and understanding as to our dilemma. They gave us a great rate and sent a shuttle driver over. He was fantastic, told us about the Big Blue bus which goes to the Santa Monica Pier for 1.00 each way per person, if he felt better later. The hotel itself reminded me of the motels I stayed at as a child with cute touches of flowers everywhere, pool in the courtyard and little private places to sit and have quiet time with your family. It's like a tropical oasis near the airport. Everyone was so nice and the room was older but clean and comfortable. To top things off, the next day we went to dennys (next door) and I forgot my beautiful black coat and didn't realize until I had already gone through security at the airport. I called Dennys and they brought it to the hotel front desk. Then I called the front desk and they put my coat on the shuttle, where I met the same driver who graciously handed me my coat, at the airport with plenty of time for me to catch my plane. Everyone was so nice and I was so grateful for such an unexpectedly nice layover. I can not reccomend this hotel enough. I have stayed at many 4 and 5 star hotels less service and less clean environments than here. My son and I agreed that this would be our top pick if we find ourselves in this area again.

Reviews.Title: “Not only is this a dump; you can't sleep because of the traffic & plane noise ALL NIGHT LONG!!!”
Reviews.Author: Matuca
Reviews.Content: I've never bothered to write one of these reviews before. But considering, its 3 am and the NON-STOP traffic noice is keeping me awake, I thought I'd warn anyone that might consider staying here, that it is right on West Century Blvd and Aviation Blvd- I mean my room is 20 feet from the road! The airport shuttles come by every minute or two. (Ironically, you can't hear them all the time: every 5 minutes or so, the light rail train or a plane will drown out the bus noise.) I was arriving late and thought, it would be a convenient place to crash and get an early start. Well that hasn't worked out. Other than the noise: I've stayed in Travelodges before and didn't have high expectations. Like most of them, it is old and run down. I believe the bathroom show IS the one shown in the TripAdvisor warning pop up.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem on our way to Ausrtrailia.”
Reviews.Author: rtjny99
Reviews.Content: Shows its age (the only reason for the slight down grade). BUT... Very clean. Very accomodating personnel. Nice continental breakfast. Beautiful gardens with fresh flowers all over the place, inside and out. Large pool. More like a resort setting than an airport crash pad. No full service restaurant but an attached 24 hours full service Denny's restaurant and lounge. 24 hour shuttle to LAX. All this for $84 in 2011. Kudos.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Safe, Friendly, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: EarthOn5DollarsADay
Reviews.Content: We always stay here now in LA. 5th or 6th time in 3 years. The hotel is old and tired, but clean and safe and cheap. Staff are friendly. Breakfast lady Sara is Awesome. Best value for a cheap overnight stay near the Airport

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable place to stay overnight”
Reviews.Author: ktown_traveller04
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night after having a late arrival from LAX. Hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Shuttle service from the airport was free and efficient. Rooms are a bit dated, but clean and comfortable. An old motel style with several different buildings. Close to the airport, and for $60 AAA rate, a great place to stay after a long day of flying.

Reviews.Title: “not expensive, sometimes noisy”
Reviews.Author: Geographtraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice at this LAX hotel (jan-feb 2011). It is an ideal place to sleep if you have an early departure of LAX or a late arrival. Rooms are generally clean, although bathrooms could use some renovations (but considered the price they are OK). The bed quality was twice good. Rooms tend to be very noisy - both from the airplanes (logical next to the airport) and from other guests arriving/departing all night and using the kind of noisy trolleys. Breakfast is small but OK, although the breakfast room is small (additional outside seatings when weather permits). Staff is friendly - although not always fluent in English but they try very hard to help you out with everything. Important for LAX: there is FREE parking, FREE WIFI (good quality/speed), and a FREE LAX shuttle (and the driver is willingly to take you to a nearby car rental agency!). Overall I would recommend it but be warned that you might mis some sleep due to the noise....

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, friendly staff, great price”
Reviews.Author: JTKR
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay at this hotel every couple of years. It is an older hotel, so don't expect sleek and updated accommodations. Yet it has an appeal to the weary traveler because it is quiet, the beds are comfortable and the setting is amidst a lush garden. Their reasonable rates also include a small buffet breakfast, and an airport shuttle service. Free parking is available and we have had no problems parking, but spaces are limited. The staff has always been very courteous and helpful. For the location, amenities and price it can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you would expect, good for overnight stay close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: Mfyodor
Reviews.Content: I am staying in this hotel almost everytime I arrive in LAX in the late noon. Location is ideal for spending a night and having some rest before moving forward. Hotel provides a free shuttle to/from LAX. Dennys is two steps away for dinner. Hotel is out of way of the LAX runways and is rather quiet despite being a mile (or even less) from the airport. Hub or car rentals (Dollar, Hertz and such) are in 10-minutes lazy walk away. Clean rooms, free internet, good cable TV, helpful stuff. A no thrills and good value for money stop-for-one-night hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Goog deal for overnight stay at LAX”
Reviews.Author: maxim_mos
Reviews.Content: Not so far from the airport, plus they provide free shuttle, operating every half-hour. The rooms are big but a little dated. Free breakfast. Free internet. Overall - not bad for 69 usd (tax included).

Reviews.Title: “Ummmm .... Not sure what to say”
Reviews.Author: balis_magic
Reviews.Content: Apologies this review is late. The Travelodge LAX Hotel was quite frankly, nothing special. We stayed there at Xmas last year and it was thankfully only for one night. We found the hotel was quite a seedy dodgy place that felt unsafe. The room was very standard. They are however larger rooms. We felt like we were in a timewarp and I don't think I slept much that night while waiting for our friend to come and pick us up in the morning. It was dirt cheap so you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Can't understand the contrasting views”
Reviews.Author: Bushpig2010
Reviews.Content: My wife and I pored over Trip Advisor reviews to book our hotels during our 4 week trip to the States. Many had polarised views - each to their own I guess. But i am struggling to see why/how the Travelodge LAX has any good reviews unless the staff have written them themselves. We decided to stay at the Travelodge LAX because LA was a one night stop over and the hotel is close to the airport, the price was good and included continental breakfast, and they offered a "sleepy bear package" (a bear themed room with cookies for the kids). I must admit I wasn't expecting much due to many of the poor reviews, and I am glad that I didn't have high expectations. The room was nasty. The smell at the front door was something like the boquet of a swaggie's armpit and inside was almost as bad. Stale cigarettes in a "non smoking" room. Carpet looked like skinned dog hide but it wasn't so much the look as the greasy feel under the feet that was terrifying. I think the walls had a patterned wall paper on them at one point but looks more like a young child has gone to town finger painting with fecal matter. My favourite, when reading reviews, is when the writer of said review tells how the toilet backed up. How often does that happen in the States? It seems every second review tells of this sad indictment. Guess i must be the second review because our dunny backed up! The staff were friendly enough at the reception but when cleaning staff were told of the toilet backing up as we were fleeing from this hollywood movie set, English seemed a little too difficult understand. Front desk were more understanding of English, however. their response was quite efficient: "no problem, we will fix."...it almost sounded like an apology don't you think..? Oh, and the teddy bear theme is very clever. It was kind of a hide and seek, invisible, bear motif....On second thought, there was no teddy bear theme at all. not a bear in sight. Would highly recommend this hotel to Goths and other dark forces, Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Well, this Hotel is a Hotel near the Airport. Clean, friendly Staff. Good!”
Reviews.Author: dreamdollsinc
Reviews.Content: We are travelling since 1991 every year for nearly two weeks to this hotel. It was renamed from Airport Century Inn to Travelodge. The staff has not changed in the important areas as management, front desk and room service supervising since I can remind. When you like to have a more quiet room, ask for the rear side, all of them are clean. The premise maintenance is good and the hobby of the ground manager is the garden. Unfortunately the labeling of plants has changed. In former days the premises looked like a botanic garden with explanations and names. Perfect for the children. May be..... I do not know, where the other tripadvisor writers like to go swimming, I usually go into the pool and enjoy. The pool area and the pool itself is cleaned every day by the ground staff. A kids section is provided in the pool. The comment with bed bugs is for me not understandable. The beds are clean and the matress is renewed frequent. The rooms are clean and remodelled frequent on demand.. Towels and amenities are OK and you can obtain anything, you have forgotten, from the ffront desk. In addition there is a small shop at the entrance providing medicals, picture postcards, cold beverages and other things as souvenirs. On the area of the hotel there is a Denny´s restaurant. Unfortunately the bar has changed the opening days. Only friday and saturday you can have the "real bar feeling2 however, during the other evenings the Dennyßs staff is proud to serve you the "toxic drinks" when you are arrive middle in the night from Europe. Lots of free parking is available on the premises. You need a parking permit from the front desk (free!). Newspaper every day is free. Wifi is free, you need the code for that from the front desk (free). Breakfast is free for hotel guests and the remodelled breakfast area is OK. Just show the room key. When the hotel is fully booked, the space in the breakfast area is very limited. (...and it is often fully booked...) Only the time 09:00 of closing the door should be extended. Visitors from other countries have to battle with the time shift and jet lag. For shure you can go to Denny´s for breakfast, if you are really late in the morning. When you are there and have problems with anything, go to the front desk and they will check it. We will come back. For sure. Not to forget: they provide fridgerators and microwave in the room for a small charge. All in one: The hotel is a clean place, having the airport in the vicinity. Free shuttle service from and to the gates is available. No plane is landing direct over the hotel. Departure is anyhow to the sea side direction. Car rentals are in walking distance. Lots of shops in the vicinity and the standard touristic areas as Santa Monica (with big mall, Apple store and Abercrombie shop), Venice Beach, Redondo Beach, Fry´s electronic store (hughe!), Ralph´s and others are in short driving distance.

Reviews.Title: “Very good deal for the money”
Reviews.Author: mir773
Reviews.Content: Aloha, This is my second stay at Travelodge at LAX and it was great. The location may not be the best, but hotel is secure. Denny's is next door and the food is affordable. The staff are very nice. The room I stayed was clean. The choices on the TV was great. [ to be honest, I am a geek and I love HIstory Channel, A&E, and Discovery. ] All in all... Travelodge LAX is a great deal for the money. Go ahead and spend your money, you can not go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Great Price”
Reviews.Author: darlingtondoll
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Travelodge at LAX many times during the past 20 years and it has always been a pleasurable experience. The staff is friendly and helpful and the rooms are nicely furnished and bright. The pool is easily accessible and refreshing to swim in after a long flight or a busy day in the city. When sitting by the pool, you feel as though you're in a tropical garden and not just minutes away from the airport. There is a van to take me to LAX and I can get there quickly without worrying about being tied up in traffic. The room charge is really affordable and the gift shop has all the toiletry supplies I need to get me through my stay in Los Angeles. I would not even consider going anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!, BED BUGS, DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: iloveNewZealand
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my boyfriend for one night before going back to New Zealand, paid a lot for one night! When we got there the shuttle picked us up and we had forgotten to get cahs out for tip so we gave everything we had (around $4) nd apologised. Got to the counter and the shuttle man said something in a different language to the person at the desk and we ending up having to trek right to the back of the hotel with all our heavy bags! (we hope this was a pre reserved room and had nothing to do with our low tip! Anyway got to the room and it smelt incredibly musty but the sheets were clean and so i relaxed in bed noticing a tickling feeling on my shoulders when i woke up but throught nothing on it. We were in a hurry to get to the airport in the morning so we went and i notices a few bites on my wrist when we got there...thought it may have been mosquitos until i noticed they were in clusters of three or more and covered my feet arms and entire shoulder area (the places that were exposed when I was sleeping! IF YOU DON'T WANT TO BE COVERED IN BED BUG BITES DO NOT STAY HERE!!!! NEVER AGAIN! I expected more from Travelodge! I am not usually a complainer at all and i'n not fussy but this was just horrible and still gives me nightmares!

Reviews.Title: “a dump. surprised Travelodge put its name to this hotel!”
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Travelodge LAX en route home to Australia. While the staff were pleasant enough the hotel room itself was an absolute dump. Dirty smelly and I would never recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “UGH!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mel1962
Reviews.Content: We ended our week and a half vacation in Hawaii with a one night stop over in Los Angeles, before returning home to Texas. We were exhausted and ready to get a good night's sleep. But, this motel/hotel was not the place to do that. We needed to be near the airport, but I didn't expect the plane noise to be so loud that it felt as if they were going to land on the rooftop. And the entire place was in desperate need up updating ... everything was very 70's & smelled musty and nasty. The bed was horrible, which insured that we did not get the much needed restful night's sleep. I was so happy we did not have a longer stay here & will NEVER stay here again. For another $15 dollars, I should have booked the hotel we stayed at when we started our trip. I'll know next time, for sure!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best value location at LAX airport”
Reviews.Author: wideawake
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exactly what you need if you're arriving late or departing early from LAX and travelling on a budget. It's location is right adjacent to the airport itself and yet plane noise won't bother you (although periodic road noise might in some rooms). It's pool in the central courtyard is actually nice and the breakfast included in the price is good, although the kitchen gets mobbed near closing time, so don't leave it until the last 5 minutes! The little convenience store on site is a total rip-off at $1.75 for a small bottle of water that should cost 59c, but it is convenient. This property would benefit from somewhat better maintenance, but it's limited to very chipped paint around doorways etc; in my room everything was clean and functional. If you're searching by price this is worth a bit more than El Segundo which is futher away than you think and you should know that Inglewood is also much further from LAX and can be a rather dodgy neighbourhood at night (do NOT take your children or your Gran to Inglewood), so this location is relatively safe and MUCH more convenient. The hotel runs a shuttle bus around the airport terminals regularly - make sure you stand in the right place outside your terminal, look for the kerb markings for "Hotel Shuttles", they can't pick you up elsewhere. If you can call the front desk when you arrive they'll send the bus out for you - make sure they know WHICH TERMINAL you've arrived at - there are a LOT! If you're not renting a car you can ride the shuttle back to the Airport and get the free Lot C bus to the Airport Bus Station, where buses leave regularly for all parts of the city, or take the express bus direct to the Amtrak station downtown for onward travel. If you want to use the hotel as a base to explore the LA area you'll want to request a better room - the ones on the 2nd floor (US)/ 1st floor(UK) overlooking the pool have balconies and would do nicely. Denny's is right next door. Recommended for independent budget travellers of all ages.

Reviews.Title: “bright lights, big city and scary hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsWolf_10
Reviews.Content: I booked a few days stay at Travelodge at LAX. The location was misleading. Though the hotel is near LAX it is located in a dodgy part of Los Angeles. The hotel itself was surrounded by a large iron fence. There were six security guards protecting the onsite restaurant. Once I got into my room which contained a non working window unit air conditioner. The room also contained a box springs with large dried blood stain and I requested the cleaning staff not enter my room during my stay and one maid approached me and insisted I let her in to clean. When I refused she stated the staff worked on commission and I was depriving her children of money. When attempted to contact the hotel manager my calls were never returned.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Hayleyandmarvin
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with three friends. The room was clean and was large enough for all of us to open our suitcases. The pool and pool area were nice. The breakfast was good and was always being replenished. The shuttle service to and from airport was excellent (especially Tony the driver, very friendly and helpful), but there is not a great deal in the local area. It takes quite a bit of time to get to any tourist attractions. If you want a clean, comfortable, cheap place to stay by the airport this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a couple of nights”
Reviews.Author: davejem
Reviews.Content: The only problem was it being so far away from the City......Then again you would book a hotel closer to the city if you wanted to explore the city. I also had the loudest person in America sat outside my room talking her friend on her mobile at 8.30am. Other than the above i would recommend this hotel as a stop over - couple of nights stay. There is nothing around the area and you most definitely need a car to explore. I would recommend LA City tours if you want to get to grips with LA, I went on a 5 and a half hour tour, I got picked up at 9:10 and dropped off at 5:30pm - you do the math! I paid $65 for it and it was the best tour i`ve been on. Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough for price, layout helps you forget you're at the airport.”
Reviews.Author: Spoocaz
Reviews.Content: The Travelodge LAX is a decent enough airport hotel, you get what you expect in terms of quality given the price and location. The hotel is a little different to other airport hotels we've stayed in, in that it is quite a sprawling layout with various different buildings and gardens, that at least helped you to forget you were staying right by a huge airport. It also has a pool and some helpful amenities such as a laundry. One negative was that while the room was a relatively clean it did have a slightly strange smell that hit you when you opened the door.

Reviews.Title: “travelodge saves couple from sleeping on airport floor”
Reviews.Author: melandjay
Reviews.Content: my husband and I were returning from our second honeymoon in Hawaii, when the ash cloud stopped all flights to Heathrow. We were stuck in a bewildering airport with very little money and no credit cards! (yes I know this is unthinkable in America, but some of us Brits only carry cash!) We turned to travellers aid for help and they rang different hotels for us, to try to get us a room. Finney at Travelodge was the ONLY ONE who would take us and I am so grateful to her because it is a little oasis in the middle of a sprawling urban jungle. It took us 24 hours to aquire the money to pay for the 6 nights that we spent there (well done moneygram service) and if it hadnt been for this hotel we would have had to remain in the airport on the floor somewhere. the hotel itself is clean, with a nice little pool, complimentary breakfast (pastries, fruit, bagels etc) and very kind, friendly and as I have explained, helpful staff. I thought it had a 1950's parisien retro feel to it, which I loved. I would be very happy to recommend this hotel to anyone who enjoys a small, individual hotel with character and friendliness. Melanie and James, Kent, England

Reviews.Title: “my purse was stolen in breakfast room and non one can help me!”
Reviews.Author: mom_fpny
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have stayed at a hotel and left in tears. The complimentary breakfast room was crowded and there's no security check to ensure only hotel guests can enter. My purse was stolen from my chair! None of the staff offer any help, and I was told the security person is off-site/unavailable because it's a Sunday. It was the last day of my vacation and I had no IDs to get on my flight. It was a terrible experience!

Reviews.Title: “Convenience from LAX”
Reviews.Author: TheCantabrian
Reviews.Content: was very very convenient when landing late to LAX to just dump everything and hit the hay. If you have alot of luggage u want to pray for a ground level room or you'll have to contend with some hideous stairs. Room was spacious and the wireless was good. A/C worked perfectly and with Dennys next door, midnight breakfast is all the go. Free continental breakfast if you're into that. The staff were very friendly and helpful. It's good for what it needed to be.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant, but tolerable for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: sarac1985
Reviews.Content: I was not very happy with this hotel. I didn't complain during my stay, so I realize there is a possibility that the situation could have been remedied, but I just checked in for a few hours to sleep so I didn't want to waste potential time sleeping by switching rooms or something. I was a single woman traveling alone, and my room was so far at the back of the hotel, I had to walk very far to get there from the lobby or parking lot, the rest of the hotel was eerily empty, and there were a lot of homeless people hanging around the area near the parking lot. So between these factors, I did not feel very safe here. I specifically chose to stay in a no smoking room because I have breathing problems and I am sensitive to it, but my room smelled strongly of cigarette smoke when I got there. It faded, but started again, these two girls kept coming back and smoking right outside my door! I asked them to please smoke somewhere else, but they returned twice that I know of. The shower was AWFUL. It fluctuated from ice cold to almost warm, and then as soon as I could get it to the warmest setting possible (probably about room temperature), it would quickly go cold again. I just wanted to relax after a long day and I ended up fighting with the shower for quite some time, before giving up and taking a lukewarm/ice cold shower. The next morning I was woken up by a small dog barking really loudly and constantly. The room looked clean, but nothing really felt clean though I couldn't put my finger on why. Maybe my situation could have been remedied if I asked for my room to be switched, but I was only there less than twelve hours so I didn't want to waste my time, especially because it was likely a new room would have problems as well. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good for 1 night layover”
Reviews.Author: lauren28Sydney
Reviews.Content: i booked a king room for 1 night while i wait for my flight home. the room is spacious. large closet. clean crisp sheets. air con. free internet which works well. free airport shuttle. i paid a day rate for a late checkout until 8pm as my flight wasnt until the next night. i did not go to the free breakfast so i am unable to comment. there is a pool. there are stairs and not lift so if you do not want to carry luggage upstairs then request a ground floor room. it is a large complex with outdoor hallways and walk ways. im travelling alone and i was placed in a room upstairs and far from the lobby. i didnt arrive until midnight and i didnt feel that sfae being so far from the lobby. they do have security who were checking an open fire exit when i arrived (they did not know how it was opened and the alarm hadnt gone off!) the rooms have dead locks and latches which i felt better with! they have free tv and heaps of pay per view channels. there is a coin operated laundry. there is a dennys on site but there is also a carls jr just down the road annd a convenience store across the road. there is a pool which was being used by a lot of people and they have room service also. i was happy with this room for my lay over. i would stay again but would request a downstairs room near the lobby. just remember that its budget.

Reviews.Title: “OK for Day or Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: Member From Shellharbour Australia
Reviews.Content: We spent a few hours to catch up on sleep before our next flight, and the Travelodge was convenient . Interesting, different 60s style building with traditional motel layout. Rooms not flash but OK. Close to runway so not overly quiet. Can take the blue bus to Santa Monica, or private bus to Manhattan Beach if you have time for a quick look, or take blue bus to rapid train station if you want to go further afield, but it is not really a good location to be based for a few days. Overall fine for a brief stopover between flights but wouldnt stay for any length of time.

Reviews.Title: “worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Lee_g15
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travelodge LAX on 2 occassions. Overall we were happy with our stay. Good - close to airport (we were flying in/out of LAX), complementary airport shuttle, decent size clean rooms, friendly staff, complimentary breakfast, basic amenities (ironing & hairdryer), close proximity to Denny's, free wireless internet in your room Bad - airport/traffic noise from outside (noisy but bearable), 40 mins away from the city Tip: * When arriving at LAX make sure you call the hotel & wait at the red 'hotel courtesy' sign. Make sure you flag the pick up car * $12 taxi fare to the hotel * Breakfast closes at 9am sharp * The Ocean Express - you can hop on/off to Manhattan Beach & Manhattan Village for only $5 round trip. The bus station is 1 block away * if you're in hollywood & can't find your way home - catch the train to union square ($1.50) & take the fly away to LAX ($7.00). Then wait for the complementary shuttle to arrive to take you back to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good, but a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: Polandio
Reviews.Content: Great value, clean, really close to the airport. My sister who just came to the USA slept really well after her 12hr flight, for me it was a little bit noisy. But I would recommend for the quick stay (1-2 nights)

Reviews.Title: “Travelodge on Century Blvd.”
Reviews.Author: ctripad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night in between our way back home from vacation. I only recommend one night. It looks like it was built in the early 1970's. The room was modestly upgraded and had a unpleasant smell like carpet powder cleaner. They put us farthest out from the lobby and the hotel location is not the best in LA. You do have a well known restaurant chain next door which is good. The shuttle is on the hour during certian hours and you need to call them if you need them to pick you up. It is a small shuttle bus only holding 9 people. There is free Continental breakfast in the morning. We picked it because we just needed a place for a few hours, it had 24hours shuttle service from LAX , and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Passable for one night”
Reviews.Author: TNTraveler68
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at this hotel after flying in from Nashville. We had booked a cruise leaving the next day from Long Beach. Found the hotel on the internet and thought the price was "right" for a one night stay. After seeing the place in person, I was a bit disappointed at the price. The rooms we had were very run down and the beds extremely uncomfortable. Our friends in the next room found gummy bears in their made up bed. We were traveling with my 80 year old mother and the hotel had no elevators...luckily, we were only on the second floor. I blame myself for that...for not checking about elevators. On the plus side, the staff were very friendly and helpful. Checking in and out was a breeze. The hotel provided free shuttle service to and from the airport which is always nice. Denny's rest was on the property and so we didn't have to get out and go in search of our dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: msz043
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to catch an early flight out of LAX. Don't let the exterior fool you. This is surprisingly a pretty big and nice place on the inside. Room was clean, comfortable and overlooked a courtyard with a well-kept tropical garden. Pool looked nice but was loaded with kids. Wi-fi was in good working order. The neighborhood is LAX and pretty industrial and no fun if you don't have a car. Very few good eating options unless you drive to Westchester. Great place for a layover or short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Icky”
Reviews.Author: CanadaFamily
Reviews.Content: Maybe we got a bad room. Maybe we were just unlucky, but this was one of the filthiest hotels which I have stayed in for a long time. The toilet was clogged. The drapes were dirty. The covers on the bed felt like something sticky was on them. The second floor room means hauling luggage up stairs and through a maze of a complex with no one available to help. The shower was clean (thank goodness). The bed was lumpy. The room was noisy and the blackout curtains had a gap under them. The shuttle from the airport took almost an hour to show up after phoning. I was totally not impressed. Really glad to checkout. Booked this room on the half day rate for a stopover. next time, will pay $30 extra and go to the Sheraton or Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful”
Reviews.Author: peterBroadstairs
Reviews.Content: Helped us find a church on Sunday that wecould get to by bus. Handy for the airport and local buses. Comfortable rooms. Next door to Dennys restaurant which we found better than the Hilton where we spent the next night. Peter & Norma, Broadstairs UK

Reviews.Title: “Too many inconveniences”
Reviews.Author: Guero45
Reviews.Content: This motel is reasonable priced with an airport shuttle and hot water. Other than that, you get what you pay for. Being on the first floor, the upstairs room creaked and shook everytime someone walked up there and since this an Airport motel, they arrived at 12:30am and stayed up all night. The front desk needs to be more aware and courteous of this, not the vacationer. Half of the T.V channels went out due to a defective cable wire and was not repaired even after a maintenance person inspected it. The air conditioner vents were broken, the air was musty and the unit was loud. The bathroom fan could wake the dead and the fluorescent lights had to be touched each time in order to illuminate. And if you get a room on the street you better a deep sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “A good no frills pit stop”
Reviews.Author: JodyWSpokane
Reviews.Content: All in all, I suppose this will sound like a bad review, but this hotel served its purpose well. Room with 2 queen beds near LAX for under $100 with free parking and breakfast. All of our requirements were met satisfactorily. If you are looking for 4 star quality and service, you won't get it, but you aren't paying for it either. We normally stay in Marriott hotels, but tried to make our recent trip to Los Angeles a little more affordable on this particular night before catching an flight out of LAX the next morning. The service was pleasant, but definitely not the "go out of your way to make it the best stay ever" that we have grown accustomed to. The room was surprisingly clean and spacious. It was right on a busy street, so quietness is not top of the list though with the air conditioner running all night, you miss most of it. Breakfast left a lot to be desired unless all you are looking for is a bagel and an orange. Pure continental carbs for a quick get-em out the door. Also, not much room to sit down and eat. We had to go sit outside which was ok. The hotel is attached to a Denny's, but I don't know if there were vouchers to eat there instead. They weren't offered to us. Next time I would definitely skip the provided meal and hit Denny's. If an inexpensive/no frills pit stop is what your looking for, then this is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great day room rate”
Reviews.Author: zoolster99
Reviews.Content: The advertised $49.95 (+ tax) day room rate (stay 8am to 8pm) and free airport shuttle was the drawcard for me when we had a ten hour layover at LAX. As mentioned in other reviews, the hotel is dated and in need of a spruce up. But for the convenience of somewhere to rest and freshen up and the added value of a pool (unheated) and free continental breakfast (6-9am daily) & Wi-Fi, it is perfect. The rooms are standard with decent sized tv and coffee make (no fridge). Breakfast was a crowded affair in a small room with few tables. Most guests bring a tray from their room and pile it high with bagels, toast, coffee and watered down juice then carry it back to their rooms or eat outside. It is what you come to expect from a "free continental breakfast!" There is a Denny's restaurant next door. This property more than served it's purpose as a break between flights and represented value for money.

Reviews.Title: “OK but wouldn't recommend the area”
Reviews.Author: Kristina_EU
Reviews.Content: Not the best choice, but should be OK for one night if you need to be close to the airport, the hotel has a free shuttle to the airport. I was there for three nights, and didn't like it very much. But everything worked, the room was clean, kind of ugly though, with wallpaper in the bathroom :(. Earplugs are a must due to the location-LAX :). Complimentary breakfast from 6 to 9, minimum: cereals, bagels, coffee, juice, apples and bananas. Make sure you go early, otherwise there will be no fruit or juice left. Staff not exactly friendly, but OK-ish. The worst part is the location, I was travelling alone and I thought I’d feel safe close to the airport, but there are a lot of strange people around. Don’t walk alone during the night and you should be fine. Free wifi, but If you don’t have your own computer, they charge a fortune for the internet use at the reception, $1 per 3 minutes, but the advantage is that you can print your boarding pass (additional charge though) if you make the ckeck in online. If you need to reach LA or Hollywood by public transportation, make sure you check the website www.metro.net first, otherwise you’ll have a lot of problems trying to ask for information, most of the people are tourists like you and if you ask at the reception, they’ll tell you to take a taxi or offer you some useless area map or printed info sheets. Cheap way to reach Hollywood: bus 117 from opposite the hotel until Hawthorne Station –about 5 minutes and then bus 312-about 1 hour, $1.25 each or you could ask for a ticket and transfer-should be about $1.40. You get off the bus on Hollywood Walk of Fame which was quite cool.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Adequate for a Transit Hotel or 1 night stay”
Reviews.Author: DalissMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a day rate $49.99 plus tax from 8am to 8pm as we had just arrived from Australia and had a 12 hour wait until a flight to San Francisco. Shuttle Bus arrived within 15 mins, we ate the complimentary continental breakfast on arrival which was more than adequate: fruit, pastries, toast, bagel, oatmeal/porridge, juice and coffee. Breakfast room was small and a bit crowded but we were able to get a table. Room was on the 2nd floor at the back of the building, longish walk to get there and no elevators. Room was large and clean, bathroom small but clean. The room was old but you need to be realistic here...this is not supposed to be a luxury hotel. I found this hotel to be perfectly adequate for the price as a transit hotel. Re the location: I didn't feel that the neighbourhood was seedy or dangerous at all. I know a lot of reviews say they didn't feel safe here and wouldn't walk around the streets nearby but I felt perfectly safe, there were plenty of people around both driving and as pedestrians. Oh and I loved having Denny's next door to the hotel. Try their $ 2 icecream and donuts - YUM!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: ponderstibbons
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a clean, reasonably-priced no-frills hotel to stay the night before a cruise. That's pretty much what we got, so we were satisfied. It's an older hotel, fairly well maintained, but not elegant by any means. The rooms were clean but basic. It wasn't possible to open the windows more than about six inches, but there were in-room air conditioners. The airport is right at the east end of the LAX runways, but since flights take off and land east-to-west, there's very little noise from the airplanes which are landing every couple of minutes on both sides of the hotel. There's more traffic noise than airport noise. The neighborhood was mostly businesses, not much ambiance. The continental breakfast was also basic but otherwise fine. The airport shuttle was prompt and the driver was helpful. The hotel does NOT have an elevator, so you'll have to carry your luggage up stairs if you're on the second floor.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck”
Reviews.Author: TijosLtd
Reviews.Content: The hotel is run down. For the price (we paid $60/room), I suppose you don't really get the right to complain, but it truly is not a nice hotel. I wouldn't be writing in because the price pretty much says it all, but some of the reviews make it sound like a wonderful hotel and it's important that people know that their $60 is only buying you a room that is worth $60 less. The hotel is very run down. The rooms and the bathrooms are grimy. The hotel is spread out and as best as we can make out there is no one to help with your luggage and there are no elevators. We were on the 2nd floor at the back of the hotel and had a lot of luggage as a family of 4 coming back from a very long trip. It was quite a journey to get all our luggage into the rooms. Another problem was that we waited at the airport for 45 minutes for the hotel shuttle when we were told it would be there in a couple of minutes. Overall, I would not recommend this room for anyone other than maybe a individual man who just needs a cheap place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - useful for car returns and flight departures”
Reviews.Author: MrTWS
Reviews.Content: The Travel Lodge at LAX Airport is a small treasure really - on one hand it has suitable rooms, an outdoor pool, free internet access and a patio for sitting and relaxing at, plus for us, Thrifty Car Rental was near enough right opposite, and a free complimentary shuttle service that takes you to the airport. The staff were pleasant and helpful, and the actual hotel is not bad at all, but sadly because it is an airport hotel, it might not always get the recognition it deserves. The room was okay - nothing special but then again, it was far from being a dump. The hotel is after all probably more used by people travelling from the nearby LAX airport rather than a long stay answer for a dream holiday. It is a shame since the actual swimming pool area and pavements and rooms all face into that area, and it seems like one of the best for airport trips.

Reviews.Title: “an oasis”
Reviews.Author: LisaFife_Scotland
Reviews.Content: stayed herefor a few nights before heading to Las Vegas, after a long journey, this lodge is just what I needed, quick book in, nearby room on ground floor, wasn't too keen on my door being almost on the outside public path, it had a small fence and security gates, but it turned out fine, I travel alone so security or at least a feeling of security is very important, had plenty locks on the door though. Denny's on site (great), and a 7/11 garage on site too. Although near to airport, no aeroplane noise, a lot of people walking around, an adult cinema across the road and some video stores, but people just went about their business, never had any bother. Good friendly atmosphere in the breakfast room (free), lots of info for tourists. Room was huge, very clean, had everything you need, blankets, irons/boards, big telly, huge bathroom. Will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a night, the kids enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: nikki120683
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travelodge Los Angeles Airport South. There were 6 of us: my mom and I were in room 207 and my brother, his wife and 2 kids (8 & 11) were in room 206. We only stayed for one night, Saturday Feb. 6 through Sunday Feb. 7, 2010. We only stayed one night because we were headed to Carnival Splendor's Mexican Riviera cruise; and we like to fly in a day early because, coming from the northeast, we never know what the weather will be like! lol The hotel is on a main road but you don't hear the traffic while in your room. However, you do hear the planes coming in and out of LAX; but the noise isn't as bad as you would think. Now, I'm not a light sleeper, nor am I a heavy sleeper, but if it helps you, let me say that I wasn't woken, not once, by the noise from any incoming or outgoing planes at LAX. The biggest positives about this hotel are its location, the variety of food available in the continental breakfast, the service, and THE BED'S! I've stayed in MANY hotels; from crappy motels in MA, to 3 and 4 star hotels all over the country, and 5 star Hotels in Spain & Portugal. NO HOTEL HAS HAD A MORE COMFORTABLE BED THAN THIS TRAVELODGE...NONE! I'm not over exaggerating, this bed was soft but firm at the same time..I can't even explain it. If I could've taken home the mattress I would've! lol However, I didn't like the pillows; they were too soft for my taste...but hey in my opinion it was a fair trade. My back didn't hurt in the morning and I woke up very well rested. Even my mom, who "can't live without" her bed (a pricey Serta because of her back probs), had nothing but high remarks for the mattress! The hotel offers free Shuttle service to and from the airport which was a plus for us. Also, both front desk employees (overnight and in the morning), were extremely helpful and very nice. The morning manager helped us find a taxi that took us to Long Beach Cruise Terminal for $70! Yes..all 6 of us with all of our bags...which were plentiful lol. The continental breakfast offered more than I anticipated: a variety of muffins, danishes, cinnamon rolls, toast (white and wheat), waffles, fresh fruit, coffee (good coffee too...which is saying something since I can't live without Dunkin' Donuts!), and two different juices (apple and orange). Even though we were on a main street, the area seemed pretty safe. We even walked to a restaurant close by called Stick N' Steins (recommended by the night desk clerk..it was excellent) at 9 pm, and we felt perfectly safe. And in the morning, the kids used the outdoor heated pool, which they loved. Now comes the bad. The room was typical of what you would expect in a 2 star hotel. The carpets could use a GOOD deep cleaning. There were even staples near the bed which my mom stepped on..she wasn't happy. Also, when we first entered the room my mom needed to use the restroom and found a hair on the toilet seat and toilet paper in the toilet. It's not like there was pee in the toilet bowl or anything, it just looked like maybe the hair came from the cleaning crew and they used toilet paper to wipe something and just chucked it into the toilet. We complained about that but there was no cleaning crew on duty at the time so we just used our own Lysol wipes (which we never travel w/out) and wiped it ourselves. The room had a coffeemaker w/ coffee, a microwave, and a fridge...which were all spotless. But, the problems continued in the bathroom. The grout on the floor, and the grout around the tub and inside the tub were full of mildew. The whole bathroom needs a good cleaning with some Soft Scrub and good ol' fashioned elbow grease...EW. The last thing I was disappointed with was the TV. It was big enough, but the color and picture on it were horrible. I know, you don't stay in a hotel to watch TV, but it's a little annoying when you're trying to watch the news and the anchor looks like an Oompah Loompa due to bad color and fuzzy picture! Other than those few issues, the Travelodge LAX South was perfect for one night and offered everything that we needed. A Ralph's, IHOP, other various restaurants, convenience store, and a strip mall are all within waking distance. I would stay there again, and I would recommend it to anyone..even for families; especially if you don't plan on spending much time in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Cheap and excellent for a one night stay”
Reviews.Author: Wiggypants
Reviews.Content: We had an overnight stay at this hotel Traveling from Australia. It was cheap, bed was comfortable (which was awesome after our long and horrible flight), water was warm, etc. We had no complaints whatsoever especially for the price. If you want to stay in LA may not be the most convenient location but if you have an overnight stay until your next flight or there on business great place to stay. Wi-Fi was free which we found didn't occur in many other hotels we stayed in (we travelled to six states stayed in 9 different hotels).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: rockisalive
Reviews.Content: Please do not let the outside of the hotel or the surrounding area fool you. This is a very nice, clean hotel. I have stayed here twice in the past two weeks and I was totally satisfied on both occasions. When I first checked in I was a bit concerned because it was dark and raining so the hotel looked a bit run down. Once I got in to my room, I was very impressed. The hotel is a bit dated by the bed was confortable, the room was clean and the bathroom was spotless. There was no bath tub but the walk in shower was the size of a bath tub. The best part about the hotel is that the wifi was free, free parking, and there is a Dennys connected to the hotel. The staff was nice and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended for families or anyone wanting a good nights sleep!”
Reviews.Author: NuttyTrucker
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice, 2 days at the start of the holiday and 3 at the end. Didnt catch the shuttle at LAX (went straight to Dollar to get the car) so can't comment on that. Staff seemed friendly enough but we found there were no elevators and had to carry all our luggage up stairs to the second floor! The hotel grounds are nice with a great pool and nice gardens and the whole complex is surrounded by a huge security fence ( you'll discover why when you go out! ) however finding space to park can be difficult as the main car park is shared with the adjacent Dennys. The first room was terrible. Nice view but the balcony doors didnt look secure. The whole room looked in severe need of renovation. Bathroom was badly lit and the shower only trickled out. No noise from the airport in this room but the fact that there was a door to the room next door and there seemed to be a gang war going on in there kept us up until it sounded like the police turned up to turf them out. Did not feel at all safe! Second room was much better. Looked to have been recently refurbished and was light and airy with double glazed balcony doors. Sadly this was spoiled by a half inch gap all the way round the entry door which we discovered when we thought there was an aircraft landing in the corridor outside! (Backs onto the airport side) Couldnt have the aircon on high as it was so noisy but didnt make any difference as the aircraft and street noise through the badly fitted door kept us awake all night! Breakfast was not bad but is served in a room the size of a large closet and there are only a few tables outside to sit at which was poor considering the size of the hotel. The Denny's next door did a much better breakfast though obviously you have to pay. Imagine most people staying here will bring or rent a car, which you WILL NEED to get around. The area is very run down and is surrounded by strip clubs and sex shops! Also seems to be a large population of local vagrants that try to con money out of you as I was stupid enough to fall for the first day, I felt a lot happier the second stay when we were told we could park in th back lot (which is inside the security fence and accessed with the room key) as i often wondered if the car would still be outisde in the morning when parked in the main car park. Walking back to the hotel from Dollar was nervewracking even for 2 young men. Area not appropriate or safe for families, lone travellers or anyone of anyone fo a nervous disposition should beware. In summary, hotel grounds and pool were nice. Lack of elevators, poor rooms and breakfast area make this a poor hotelUnless they make substantial changes you'd be better paying the extra $5 a night and stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Good for overnight LAX stay”
Reviews.Author: jackieca
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Travelodge at the beginning and at the end of our trip as we had overnight layovers at LAX. It was a very large hotel with pretty nice grounds, and looks like it may have been a nicer hotel way back in the day. There was a prompt and free airport shuttle. The staff, including the shuttle driver, weren't exactly friendly, but they were helpful at least. The breakfast was basic, and in a small room. The hotel room seemed clean, was comfortable, and quiet. Plenty of fresh towels, soap, shampoo, coffee maker, and tons of tv channels. There was a bottle opener mounted in the bathroom doorway. Curious. There were computers in the lobby, however internet use came with a high cost. You could, however, print out boarding passes for free, and this was a nice feature. In all, good price, quiet stay, comfortable, and a nice overnight hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable priced standard motel near airport”
Reviews.Author: Dutchman-nl
Reviews.Content: Large, reasonable priced airport motel. I didn't use the shuttle service, so I cannot comment on that. Simple continental breakfast included. Long walk to room (in back building). In spite of the vicinity of the airport very quit room. Parking place is limited and shared with the Dennys next door. With the permit given at the reception parking is no problem. Given the much better comments for the more expensive Culver City Travelodge, I stayed there as well. I regretted that. Would prefer the Travelodge@LAX any time.

Reviews.Title: “LAX Travelers: No question....OUTSTANDING VALUE for OUTSTANDING LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: MustangSonny
Reviews.Content: (Warning: I simply cannot SHUT-UP about this place!) SIMPLY OUTSTANDING! At last! I found the solution to my LAX travel situations. This property is a mind-blowing value (my rate was only $62) that's incredibly convenient. MY TIP: You are about 300 yards from my FAVE place to rent cars while in LA: FOX CAR RENTAL. The Travelodge/Fox car rental combo is a money-saver for anyone or family who's coming into Los Angeles via LAX...and just needs to base for one night, before launching into their LA vacation getaway. First of all, let's rate this motel for what it promises you, OKAY? You are staying in a property adjacent to LAX. This means stripper clubs and panhandlers, folks! If you find this unnerving, then GO STRAIGHT to your DISNEY hotel, parents! But this property hires a rent-a-cop nightly to watch the place. Your rooms are "behind" a gate-locked area, so you're not exposed to the area-at-large. I felt very safe. The rooms are clean, LARGE and comfy. My in-room coffeemaker with full-spectrum cable TV was a nice way to start my morning, but the capper was having an iron that was actually "clean!" (Almost always, they are scorched and unuseable! Ha!) Onsite is a well-stocked gift/convenience shop, so Moms can stock-up their purses with granola bars/juice. And adjacent is a DENNY's. Yes, perhaps more pricey than your hometown Denny's in Hooterville, USA...but you're staying in LA, folks. YOUR rules/standards are out the window. Having this Denny's right next door is incredibly convenient for a stack of pancakes to get you squared-away for the morning! You simply must consider this hotel for what it is: AN EXCELLENT place to A) stay when you have an obnoxiously early LAX flight the next morning...or B) stay if you have a late-night arrival to LAX and need to get a rental car the next day. This Travelodge is a great solution for when you just need a place to "reconnoiter" before you launch into your LA vacation. I walked over to FOX and chatted-up an LAPD bike cop enroute! The neighborhood's patrolled. Now...if you think you're going to "go out for a little walk to check out the neighborhood?" Respectfully, you're out of your mind! You just don't DO THAT here, folks! Fuggadabbaddit! So...disregard the negative reviews that, IMO, come from amateur travelers. Any mega-huge, world-famous airport will have the adjacent contingent of seedy commerce. Therefore, spend $150+ for your few hours sleep, as those highrise properties are, indeed, in the LAX area.! But me? I'll stay here. Shuttle. Value. Clean. I will recommend this motel to friends/family. BTW: I understand the Travelodge franchise is trying very hard to "change" it's image from a low grade tourist-class property (ala "Knight's Inn")...to a nicer, more upgraded standard (ala "Quality" or "Ramada") of tourist-class accommodations. In closing, if you don't like stripper clubs, XXX theaters or panhandlers in your eyesight, then high-tail it out of the LAX area! If you're like me...and all you want is a good place to sleep that doesn't smell funny? YOU WILL LOVE THIS PLACE because of it's incredible location. PS to those who talk about NOISE... ummm...scuse me...but you're at LAX?!! Solution: EAR PLUGS. I wouldn't leave home without 'em! Although I didn't find a need for them. Yes. It's a window air conditioner, so you'll have that "noise" from the unit. But again...for $62 to have THIS MUCH CONVENIENCE?!!! I'm laughing and turning cartwheels! Have a great LA stay! Thanks to the very friendly staff I experienced upon my check-in and check-out, too! Travelodge ROCKS for value and convenience!

Reviews.Title: “I may have been better off sleeping in the airport.”
Reviews.Author: jimcarson_com
Reviews.Content: I had to cut short a business trip and wanted a place to stay before catching my morning flight out of LAX. Normally, I have had good luck with Travelodge, Location: right next to the freeway and Century Blvd. Parking lot was very crowded as it appears to share spaces with Denny's. The only positive was it's right across the street from the rental car agency. Once I checked in, I returned the car and walked back. Pretty dicey area. Rooms: a bit slimy, but would have been okay if the air conditioning worked. I just couldn't cool the room down. Walls pretty thin and the area very noisy as all get go. Around 2:30 a.m., an alarm clock went off (at full volume) in an adjacent room. They sent someone up to knock on the door several times, eventually calling the front desk on the (loud) radio. About 20 minutes later, they figured out the person inside had checked out. Never really got to sleep afterwards, so by 4:30, I got dressed and took the first shuttle to LAX. The airport was much quieter. Service: The staff was fine, though the wait to check in was kind of long. Value: Eh. I think I would have slept better on the floor at LAX. I would not recommend staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Older property but well kept and CLEAN and CHEAP”
Reviews.Author: ramunlim
Reviews.Content: Best value in Los Angeles. Free shuttle to/from airport, excellent free breakfast and prices from $45 including taxes. They are obviously trying to keep the property going with great service and they are succeeding.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect much for your money.”
Reviews.Author: grottoros
Reviews.Content: First, I waited over 2 hours for a shuttle that never came. Ended up going by taxi. Room dark and very dated. Bed and appointments comfortable except the coffee-making gear looked scarey. Grounds interesting and staff reasonably friendly. No ceremony. For a quick stay, convenient and cheap, As a holiday destination, not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap for the area”
Reviews.Author: PerryQuad
Reviews.Content: This was a very economical hotel for a pre-cruise Saturday layover. Make sure you understand the way to arrange shuttle because it is not listed on your confirmation email. You have to locate the hotel after you gather your luggage an locate the hotel board. Once I connected with hotel, shuttle was there within the hour. We were put in a smoking pet room late at night. The front desk will arrange a taxi service for you to the cruise the next morning. The taxi wasn't a local taxi, but rather a limo. The driver was excellent, but was a little more than a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Very good deal”
Reviews.Author: mir773
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 7 full days and I really like it. The breakfast was good enough for my needs and staff was more than helpful. Yes, the place is old, but should be no problem for most adults. Cheap food nearby, Denny's, Carl's Jr and Micky D's nearby saves you money. Go ahead an spend your hard earned money on the place, while it not be perfect, it is a very good deal for the price. God blessing to all.

Reviews.Title: “These people get it”
Reviews.Author: frankhurtte
Reviews.Content: First, this is not a brand new facility. As a matter of fact it is quite old. But, they understand customer service. They track the ratings that people give them on tripadvisor ... and they are doing everything in their power to drive those ratings. The place is clean - but its old. The people literally bend over backwards to help you. I arrived late in the evening and needed to drop off a rental car - so I didnt need to mess with it in the morning. They arranged for their driver to pick me up. And in the morning, they arranged for two wake-up calls to make sure I got out on time. And, they are just minutes from the airport...

Reviews.Title: “Such a Perfect Gem Amidst the OverPrice and Overrated Area Hotels!”
Reviews.Author: TheBizLeisureTravler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for about 10-12 times a year for the last fifteen years! It such a sweet place to stay! In fact when I am there on business, I extend my stay into a leisure rest for the remaining week or weekend while in town to jsut stay at the hotel!! First off you really dont expect much from the outside interior but once in, WOW!! The have enchanting gardens, the rooms are very oversized, a gorgeous pool! It is very quiet and you will never hear the airplanes that are landing or approaching 1/4 of a mile away! The interior is so relaxing you forget your at LAX or even Los Angeles! I have stayed at the big hotels in the area and never found them to comapre to this little gem of a hotel/motel. The staff is great, there is a attached Dennys to the Lobby that has good food for those that realize they are eating in a family restaurant and not a upscale restaurant! The continental Bkfst is way beyond what other hotels offer! The food is fresh as well as the juices, coffee, milk are fresh - no watering down!! The rooms are oversized with good quality linens, decor and furnishings! In fact it has the same quality of furnishngs I recently encountered at a Radission and Hilton!! Good Internet service and loads of cable television selections. I feel safe here as the property is completely enclosed and you do not notice the security until you leave via a exit gate arpound the property. In fact anyway entering the motel must show proof of being a registered guest or if someone is visiting they must provide the guests name and room number. You dont see anyone loitering or situations around the complex at all. In fact when you look out yor balcony or patio, it feels like your looking at your Hawaiian Property gardens!! Bravo Travelodge LAX your a a blessing in disguise!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never been to Los Angeles. Well worth the money for a quick stay.”
Reviews.Author: jdstanifer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had never been to Los Angeles before and we were just getting away for the weekend and wanted something close to the airport and inexpensive. This was a great place to stay for a quick visit. The price was reasonable, it had continental breakfast, and a good sized pool. It wasn't as clean as it could have been and the parking was inconveniant but overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Bearable”
Reviews.Author: ausytraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night, from a long trip from Singapore to L.A., so wanted to stay near LAX airport as it is hard to get around L.A. I found that the price was not worth it. I paid 100 dollars AUS a night. And the hotel was more like a motel. The room had not much light and was dark and smelt a bit damp. The aircon was really loud when you turn it on. I saw a silvermoth on the comforter of the bed. I could hear so much traffic noise from outside but was so exhausted did not really notice it. The hotel is near Denny's diner and petrol station. Denny's is okay for an overnight stay. Has salads, steak dinner and burger etc... The only highlight would be the pool. The breakfast was very simple, ate from paperplates with bagels and cereal. There is a free shuttle from LAX to the hotel which was good an convenient. Overall, alright for an overnight stay if it was cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice - low price, easy access, near to LAX and car rentals, free parking and shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: MIJOVU
Reviews.Content: Very good for the price (paid 55 euros / twin room / night) and near location to LAX airport. Of course it is old and dark, but what could be expected with this price. Staff was friendly and free shuttle service to airport every 30 min. worked perfectly. So; low price, easy access, near to LAX and hired car returns, free parking and free shuttle service (took 5 min. to get to LAX). Travellers from Finland

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, breakfast so simple...... would search for some place else...”
Reviews.Author: filmaker
Reviews.Content: If I was back to L.A. would look for some place else, it't not too bad, but it's not what you look for when you are in hollydays for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Could Not Get Out Soon Enough!”
Reviews.Author: DylanToronto
Reviews.Content: One night stay before leaving from a 2 week southern Calilfornia vacation. The room was hidden far away in the back of the second building. The room was dark, smelled terrible and there was smelly mold in the dated bathroom shower (no bath). Beds felt like cardboard, the picture on the tv was so bad it made me dizzy looking at it. No fridge. Breakfast was absolutely horrific. One woman working there toasting bread in a small terribly cramped room rudely telling me and my kids we could not take our own bread. They ran out of most items by 8am, did not restock, nowhere to sit. Extremely uncomfortable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Airport hotel?”
Reviews.Author: trazzel
Reviews.Content: This place is located only five minutes from LAX but they could just as well have been on the other end of LA because you won't get to them quickly. Just as other review(s) stated below their shuttlebus pickup service is horrible. We had to call them three times and wait almost one and a half hour for them to pick us up at the airport. While waiting, we saw the other hotel shuttles at least five times each! This is NOT acceptable and therefore merits the lowest score. But, if you got plenty of time and dont mind caliing multiple times and waiting for at least an hour, by all means, book this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for. . .okay for a LAX layover”
Reviews.Author: Plan-it-chick
Reviews.Content: I only paid $60 for one night so I wasn't expecting much. I got in at 1:00AM so I had to call three times until I got someone on the phone for the airport shuttle. That was a bit frustrating but I just rolled with it because I was tired. The desk staff person was friendly and pointed out the breakfast and internet usage. I had a hard time finding my room because it was all the way in the back. I helped another woman try to find her room. It's a bit confusing. The room was just okay. The bathroom was very clean but it only had a shower. The bed was okay. There was an air-conditioner left running in the room which made the air stale. The really liked that there was a Denny's right next door though.

Reviews.Title: “P+I from Finland”
Reviews.Author: Pauli666
Reviews.Content: Rooms stink. Very noisy area. Breakfast end at 9am, and there is nthg to eat at 9:01am. No fridge in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Its all about money, not about service”
Reviews.Author: SparklingM
Reviews.Content: They booked me in on the wrong date then proceeded to make me pay a no-show rate. Would not even consider that they had made a mistake and would do nothing about it. Service was really average and there was no fridge. Plenty of cheap options nearby - try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Cmurray56
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, very clean, very safe, excellent staff, magnificent gardens. Close to public transport, free airport shuttle. loved the free ice machines. All staff members excelled in their customer service. Free breakfast really good, we were well cared for by the breaky staff. Will go back to stay for a longer visit. Well done to all the staff. Should have a 5 star rate.

Reviews.Title: “A Good One-Nighter”
Reviews.Author: Bima
Reviews.Content: We got the Travelodge LAX for $55 on the net, and it was more hotel than I expected for a Travelodge by the Airport. The hotel consists of several buildings on extensive grounds, so rooms beyond the pool are a hike, but they're quiet. If sleep is a priority, DON'T get a ground-floor room by the pool! There's internet available, and a small store in the hotel and an attached Denny's (24 hours) mean that you can get the necessities and avoid starvation no matter when you arrive. Rooms are reasonably large, with decent beds and many channels of cable TV on big screens, and everything functioned fine. The rooms are a bit dark, but after a long flight, that's a plus. If you're booking into a Travelodge for a honeymoon or a resort vacation, you're a victim of natural selection to begin with, but if you're looking for an efficiently (if impersonally ) run hotel with good shuttle service, a pool for unwinding the airplane kinks, and quiet rooms at a bargain price where you can grab some sleep after you get off the plane, you'll find this a convenient option.
