Reviews.Title: “Very reasonable rate in a scary neighborhood very close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: chicagoan5
Reviews.Content: I had to stay near LAX for a very early flight. This turned out to be a reasonably good choice. I didn't want to pay high dollar for a very short night of rest. The neighborhood: there was an apartment complex to the east of the hotel. It had a brick wall perimeter fence with barbed wires on top (it almost looked like a prison) and it told me what kind of place I was in. There were panhandlers asking for money when I tried to fill up the tank in the gas station next door. However, Westin hotel was only about one block away and several car rental companies were also on the same block. The street was busy but the neighborhood was very marginally safe. The hotel and the room: they gave me a room that was way at the backside of the hotel (it had several separated buildings). It took me more than 10 minutes to locate it. There were many plants hiding some of the passage ways. The room was reasonably clean and had most of the things you would expect from a regular inn. The window A/C was typically noisy. The hotel clerks were polite and firm (not the smiling kind). The pool looked very clean. Overall: I am fine with this place for one night. I don't think I would want to stay there any longer than 12 hours. This is not a vacation hotel. For a short stay, it was OK. I was concerned about our safety for getting out early in the morning (5AM). But it turned out OK. I was also concerned about leaving the rental car in the parking lot overnight, so I returned the car early. The shuttle was very prompt in getting us to LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a night”
Reviews.Author: roundtrip08
Reviews.Content: Had to wait a while for the shuttle from the hotel compared to other hotels whose shuttles seemed more frequent. Staff were rude on check in and did not tell us about the breakfast which meant we were not ready in time to eat it before we had to leave for our flight. Room was spacious and reasonably clean apart from a few ants in the bathroom. Shuttle bus in the morning seemed to leave early as we were there at 7 only to be told it had gone and we would have to wait half an hour. Was convenient computers in the lobby which allowed us to check in online and print boarding pass for free. Was ok for a night not for an extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “thank god it was only one night”
Reviews.Author: adamsduo
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for one night because we had a real early flight to catch. The room was ok but the bed was really hard and the ac didnt work real well. there is no elevator so we had to carry our bags up steps that were wet and slippery. There was a carpet in the doorway that was loose and slid everytime you stepped on it. The gardens were beautiful and peaceful as well as the pool, however outside the gate the area was real scary with sex shops nearby and streetpeople out front and in the ally we heard sirens all night and were afraid to leave the room. We had a rental car that we turned in early because we didnt feel it was safe in the parkng lot. The shuttle service was fine and on time and the Dennys was ok, nothing real special. The room was clean and internet worked fine, I wouldnt stay here for more than one day.

Reviews.Title: “Travelodge very convenient and well priced stay”
Reviews.Author: BordoNsw
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently while waiting for our flight home which didnt leave until midnight. I took the half day stay rate at 50 dollars and found it to be very good. Beds were concrete hard which is no good for my bad back. Free high speed wireless internet was excellent. NO aircraft noise either which is good for a hotel so close to LAX. Airport shuttle service was convenient to. When we opened the door to the room the musty smell was intense but after an airing it was ok. When we were there drugs were found in one room and they were waiting for police to arrive. I'm not saying that this is an everyday occurence but it happened none the less. Otherwise an ok stay and would recommend. We didn't use the pool but it was large and clean. No spa.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic for transit weary -”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneDes
Reviews.Content: We stayed here transitting from Melbourne to NY and it was fine for the price. rooms were clean, staff friendly and willing to direct us to public bus transportation for sightseeing. Do be aware this is the only travelodge that offers the hotel pick up the other one says it does, but does not, and some weary travellers were left behind. We also discovered they have a 49 dollar half day rate so if you do not want to hang out at lax with your luggage waiting to go back to Australia, it is a great bargain. There is no place at LAX to store luggage. we were able to kill our 6 hours for our next flight with a beer by the pool in a small patio garden outside our room. For our budget and for our travel transit purposes it was great. (only complaint American coffee..) Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Awful experience with staff”
Reviews.Author: dnz80
Reviews.Content: This is a very inexpensive hotel but most of the staff really make you remember you are paying little money per room. I went to LA for a quick shopping break and to pick up my new puppy. As soon as I got to the main gate of the airport I phoned the hotel, 50 minutes later they picked me up and took me to this hotel that is located only 5 minutes away by car. The gentleman at the front desk that night was actually polite. That night was actually ok. The room is nothing special but you can't really expect much for the price. Early the next morning I asked the shuttle driver if he could drop me off at the airport on his next shuttle service (I wasn't leaving yet but I needed to pick up my dog) In a very rude way he answered he didn't know and then he said the car was full and turned away leaving me talking alone. Later that day was supposed to check out however my flight scheduled had been moved to the next morning due to the weather. I went to the front desk at 10 am to see if they had room available for that night which they confirmed. By this time my credit card had been locked as I did not notified my bank I was going to be traveling those days so I was to get back to the room, get some cash and come back to the front desk to check out and switch rooms. I go back to my room, finish packing and then try to call my bank to their toll free number to unblock my credit card but I couldn't call out, I then call the front desk and they tell me I can't call out anymore because they have already checked me out and that I need to "immediately" leave the room (check out time was still 1.30 hrs away). I went back to the front desk to try to work it out and make the toll free call to my bank... long story short these two ladies were absolutely nasty so I checked out. I asked the driver if he could take me to the airport this time, his answer was beyond impolite. I couldn't get a taxi with my large dog at that time in the morning so I walked with my luggage, its kennel and my dog to a very nice 4.5 star hotel right next to the airport. The difference in service was like day and night. I ended up staying one more extra night just for pleasure. This other hotel definitely made me forget about that uncomfortable experience at Travelodge LAX. I was so happy to have gotten out of that place and I am for sure never never never staying there again. Keep in mind it is a cheap hotel with unhappy employees and you might be unlucky enough to get the same staff I did.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Friendly Staff, Good Airport Location”
Reviews.Author: KenSmith
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights after Easter before flying back to the UK. The staff were extremely helpful and the rooms fine. There was free WIFI access in our room, free parking and a free shuttle to LAX airport. Breakfast was quite light but adequate. Although the Travelodge is in a busy area the rooms were quiet. I was also amazed that they gave me a discount on the second night so I paid less than I was expecting. If you're flying to or from LA and need a place to stay this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a quick stay.”
Reviews.Author: Jodeskee
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Travelodge for only one night as we were flying out at around 430am the next morning. It is close to the airport and has a free shuttle service that runs every half an hour. This was the main reason for staying here. While the hotel is outdated and has a run down feel, it was perfect for the one night. It had wireless internet and a laundry. Any more than that and for any other reason then as a place to stay before flying, then I would definitely stay somewhere else. Our room was quite large with a king size bed. It had airconditioning however it was a very old machine and was a bit noisy. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for a one night/heading to the airport only stay. This is not a place for relaxing etc. You could find much nicer hotels with better value for money.'

Reviews.Title: “Worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: BobfromWA
Reviews.Content: I booked in for 2 nights on my way to Vegas. Shuttle picked up after 5 min wait at LAX. Delivered to hotel. Checkin quick and efficient. Room clean (and non smoking as requested) No lift but I had light bag so no big deal. Denny's next door, food Ok and reasonable value. Free continental breakfast Free high speed(and it was) internet Best if you have car to get around LA Clean, friendly and good value. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Dated”
Reviews.Author: Surfing-Banker
Reviews.Content: I have been using Trip Advisor for a number of years. This was the first place that really let me down. I did not realize this place was a dated motel. Luckily we were only there for a night, then flew out in the morning. The price seemed good at the time, however I used another travel search firm and got a 4 star stay at the Sheraton nearby for the exact same price.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a dump but the price was right”
Reviews.Author: terracore
Reviews.Content: Due to flight schedules, we overnighted at this hotel. The room was moderately clean, a good price, and close to the airport. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I didn’t use the pool area or similar amenities but they looked disgusting. Is pool water supposed to be green? The hotel had a few restaurants and stores within convenient walking distance. The hotel was surrounded by iron fencing and gates to protect it from the seedy neighborhood. I followed the hotel signs to their “lounge”, which was the Denny’s next door. As soon as I stepped outside the iron gate a man tried to scam me. Fortunately the distance between the hotel and the next-door “lounge” wasn’t too far. Finding our room involved a confusing labyrinth of outside corridors and turns. I had requested a non-smoking room and got a smoker’s paradise instead. The front desk courteously found us a different room that didn’t stink like nasty ash tray. Unfortunately the new room had so much noise from the adjoining street it was difficult to sleep. The room had a sign inside of it asking the guests not to leave food out as to not contribute to their problem with ants. I don’t think this statement requires any further explanation. The “bathroom” had no bath at all. It did have a toilet, a sink, and a shower stall slightly smaller than a phone booth. Everything in the room, including the doors, were covered in the same ugly wall paper. It made the doors blend into the walls like some sort of mystical place that should only reside in a disturbing dream. The décor in this establishment defies explanation. The room was incredibly ugly. My wife and child were afraid to be left alone in, or outside of the hotel. The key-card system that allows entry into our room worked capriciously, making getting into our room a process that took about 3 minutes. Hotel maintenance arrived and everything magically worked great while they were there but the problem persisted throughout our short stay. The free airport shuttle was fast (both directions) and the drivers very courteous. Due to the price I would stay here by myself if I needed a cheap room near the airport, but my daughter and wife were horrified of this place. The key word here is budget.

Reviews.Title: “almost 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: arthil
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice, five weeks apart, one night each time, on my way to and from South America. I was very happy with my room both times - spacious, clean, all the amenities I wanted - and the staff at reception were cooperative about any info I needed. The cleaning woman was smiling and gracious. I can't imagine a better location for a transit stay from the airport. The free breakfast was fine and Denny's next door was convenient; there is also information about restaurants in the area. I would have given it 5 stars if not for one overlong waiting time for pickup from the airport when I had to wait 45 minutes. From hotel to airport shuttle times were impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet reasonable for that close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: ventoboy30
Reviews.Content: After arriving by Amtrak at Union Station I took the LAX FlyAway to the airport and then walked to the hotel around 9pm. It was about a mile and quite pleasant. The room was a little bigger than I needed.

Reviews.Title: “Not The Ritz Carlton, But Is A Great Value”
Reviews.Author: MacGuffin
Reviews.Content: The Travelodge LAX is a very good value. While it is an older motel-style venue, they keep it very clean. I have stayed there many times over the years. The staff always remembers me and makes sure my stay is acceptable. They recently added new beds in nearly all rooms. The walls can be thin in some units, but that can be the case in nearly any motel/hotel that you stay at. So, for what it is, The Travelodge LAX is a good place to stay if you need a place near LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for an Airport layover”
Reviews.Author: sljvlj5
Reviews.Content: We arrived from Tahiti after an 8 1/2 hour flight in LA and needed a place to stay for the night before an early morning flight home and this turned out to be the perfect place. We called the motel from the courtesy phone in the baggage area for a free pick-up and they arrived within ten minutes, this was around 12 noon. Our room was clean with two comfortable double beds, nice bathroom with shower and lots of hot water. They also had a Dennys restaurant attached to motel with good food so we didn't have to go out looking for a place for dinner. They had a programable phone for a wake-up call which worked, which was nice since our flight left at 6:00AM. Also I must note that we were on the first floor and facing the pool and that it was very quiet. We was a little concerned after reading some of the other reviews for I booked this on-line. Also another plus was that they had two computers in the lobby where you could print your airline boarding passes for free.

Reviews.Title: “I'm never staying at another Travelodge again!”
Reviews.Author: makkuo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at a hotel for 2 weeks. He booked this place because of its low price, free internet, free parking and free breakfast. Everything in California is so expensive that parking is not free at most hotels. Turns out this place is a real dump. The wall papers are peeling, the shower is leaking and can't seem to maintain hot water. The next day, my room key stopped working. The following day, the cleaning lady threw my blankets and pillows on the floor and put them back on the bed! This was done when I was in the room! I nicely asked her to give me clean blankets but she didn't speak English so I had to call the front desk, who asked for a supervisor to come. Afterward, I spoke to the front desk, who told me that the cleaning lady said I threw the blankets on the floor!!! I was like, why would I do that??? I was ready to leave the hotel but the manager offered to move us to another room. It was a little cleaner and the cleaning lady stopped throwing the blankets on the floor. Instead, she threw them on the sofa. That's better than the floor, I guess. Aside from the cleanliness, I find the walls were thin and I could hear people talking all the time. We had problems closing the front door and had to slam it every morning. I felt bad for the guests next door. I couldn't wait to get out of there. And I'll never go there or any other Travelodge again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for everything”
Reviews.Author: MicandTez
Reviews.Content: We had a shuttle free shuttle bus from the airport and although the rooms need some work the stay was good and the staff helpful. Breakfast is seated outside but as it was January this was a bit cold still, we took breakfast back to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: courtney13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice once before travelling to Mexico and after. The free pick and breakfast is great and you can see some great sites like manhatten beach by catching the Trolley for $2.00 return. The staff were friendly. The pool looked like it had seen better days however, we werent there for that reason. the price was great, the rooms were clean and tidy and air con which was great. nothing to fault about this hotel. They also booked us on a fantastic site seeing tour of LA.

Reviews.Title: “Ick is right”
Reviews.Author: MichiganTravelmore
Reviews.Content: We stayed because it was close to the airport, but for the price, it is a VERY OLD hotel, didn't have an elevator so we had to haul our luggage to the second floor. Just had that creepy dirty old feeling. Would not recommend it or stay there again, but if it's the only place available you won't die from staying there! Try the Travelodge South, it might be better if you need a Travelodge.

Reviews.Title: “Very cautious approval”
Reviews.Author: netbob
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Travelodge now several times. The reason the reviews are so mixed is it depends on where your room is. If you get a room in the back newer part, be prepared not to sleep. The walls are paper thin, the hallways are tile so for every arrival and departure all night long you will hear the clack-clack-clack of the wheels on the luggage over the joints in the tile floor. If you are upstairs towards the back in the older part the rooms are in desperate need of renovation. First floor in the older part is a bit shabby but comfortable. So....... you pays your money and you takes your chances. On the plus side, the Denny's Restaurant adjacent is good, safe and easy to access. The shuttle service is good to and from the airport. It is very close to the airport. The wifi works well and is free. The management is responsive - we got a repair to our room within 20 minutes at 10PM at night. We had to return a rental car late at night one time and they met us at the rental place and returned us to the motel, all very agreeably. The prices are reasonable. I would say it all depends on where your room is.

Reviews.Title: “Much to be desired”
Reviews.Author: waakisa
Reviews.Content: Well on arrival late at night, we got our room, it really had a bad smell in it..........but when you arrive after midnight there is not much you can do.............the hotel offered breakfast.........the facilities were very bad, eating out side in the cold, there was no dining room to sit in................not enough tables outside for guests.......so if you are going make sure you wear a warm coat for breakfast....it was freezing standing eating cereal resting our tray on the bin!!!!!!! On Booking out I had a telephone bill to pay.......my last 20 doller bill and a bundle of change which was 2 dollers 8 cents........which had to be counted by the clerk at the desk he was not to pleased, he had to count this money...imagine.........the hotel provides a coutesy bus to the airport.............remember courtesy!!!!!!! I thanked the driver for helping me with my bag..................but unfortunately I had no change to tip him, he looked at me in discust.. ..and said 'well is that it No tip?'.............In all the years i have travelled to the US I dont think I have been treated rudely or stayed in not a nice place.........but I suppose there is always a first time........is this whats a head of travellers...is it to do with the credit crunch...........I dont know, but i do know i will not be staying in this hotel ever again. Oh and by the way if the manager of the hotel reads this please speak to the drivers of the courtesy bus, have some thought for the travellers what if they had been travelling because of a family bereavement, and maybe not thinking to tip the driver.....how rude to ask, maybe they should think before they open their big mouth.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain-Dennys Restaurant great benefit for late arrivals”
Reviews.Author: Jim000
Reviews.Content: Checkin was great-good staff. Acknowledged us when we entered the lobby. Very friendly. The bellmen helped us with the luggage. The room was very clean. Our flght was delayed and the Dennys Restaurant was a life saver. No charge to use the internet. The free continental breakfast was better than we expected.

Reviews.Title: “it's an awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: bcer100
Reviews.Content: The room we got was dark and dingy due to a blown out ceiling light and the carpet felt and looked dirty. The ceiling was peeling and patched several times. The bedding had holes in it and the beds were hard. One of the shower taps was loose and you could see the holes the taps came out of the wall. I thought we were in the "hood". There's signs on the hotel entrance door about the amount of the cash kept in the lobby and a bullet hole in our room's window. I would never stay here again. The pictures are deceiving.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: CoachTJ
Reviews.Content: Hi, I stayed at this hote for 1 night as I had a connecting flight the next day. I arrived at 11pm and after getting my bags I rang the hotel to come and pick me up. It took them 15 minutes to get there and based on the traffic chaos at LAX even at that time I thought that was a very good effort. Transfer to the hotel was quick, so was check. I booked and got a non-smoking room with a King size bed. The room was very spacious and had all the necessary amenities one needs for a comfortable stay. Free wireless internet worked and was fast. Free breakfast was convenient with enough choice. OK, do not expect a sit down and served breakfast, everybody is on the run here and the breakfast set up is perfect for that. Check-out time was 12pm but I asked if I could check-out a little later and that was no problem at all which I thought was very friendly from the Italian owner. After checking out and waiting for airport shuttle the cleaning lady came running after me and found my waiting in the lobby.......I left a very valuable gold necklace and an other necklace in my room and she came after me to give it back which was fantastic. So overall my stay was great, it was fast, convenient and service was good. The people working at the hotel are efficient but perhaps for some people's standard not friendly enough. The are focussed on getting people in and out as fast as they can because everybody is either arriving after a flight or need to catch one. In my opinion it's just the standard US service which doesn't often come with a smile, that's just the way it is and if you accept that then I think you will have a great stay. If you are into being very picky then it's best to stay at places like the Hilton or Marriott :-) I would definately stay here again if the purpose is to catch a connecting flight the next day or when arriving early in the morning and departing late at night. Maybe I would ask for a different room as my one was on the road side so slightly noisier than the ones facing the pool side.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: tvjr
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a basic motel near the hotel for our first night in Los Angeles. The Travelodge was ideal for this, the only downside was we had to ring for the shuttle bus to pick us up from the airport - most other hotels run buses automatically, and so we had a wait of about 30mins. Room was basic, but clean. Everyone friendly, and breakfast was better than the other motels we stayed in

Reviews.Title: “OK for a night stopover”
Reviews.Author: 3Kiwiflyers
Reviews.Content: This is nothing flash, but then that's not what you are paying for. If you want somewhere that is clean, close to LAX airport with a free shuttle bus and somewhere half decent to eat nearby, then this is the place for you. If you want anything more than this, then you will be disappointed because you won't get it here. We've stayed in a few LAX airport hotels now and this one (for the price) is the best so far. The shuttle was really easy to catch, the room was dated and a bit shabby with a really wierd shower in a hole in the bathroom wall, but it was quiet, easy to get to and from the airport and relatively clean. The pool is deceptively deep and very clean but damned freezing! Having Denny's onsite is a real bonus but it's not the Hilton. If you have realistic expectations and want somewhere just to crash, then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for short stopover”
Reviews.Author: nzkelly
Reviews.Content: This hotel was adequate for our needs, staff were helpful. Shuttle only runs hourly though, We had a long wait at LAX, would have been nice if they told us when we called them. Hotel was tidy, our room smelt like it had pets in it previously, besides that it was clean and comfortable. I wouldn't want to stay here for a long time, but for short layovers I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, Clean, and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: d467
Reviews.Content: Since I had a 1 night layover, I chose this hotel for its price and proximity to LAX. Upon arriving at LAX, I phoned the hotel and the shuttle was there in 10 mins. Check -in was a breeze. The lobby is nowhere close to fancy, they should really give it a makeover. I was assigned a room on the 2nd floor towards the back of the hotel. This hotel does not have any elevators, if there is one..it is nowhere in sight. On the way to my room, I passed the pool which is quite large and it was clean and I passed many pleasant flowers planted throughout the grounds.There was no bellperson present nor an elevator, so I had to struggle up stairs with my heavy suitcase. My room was in no way fancy, it was just a simple clean room. The bed was ok, I slept well. The A/C worked fine, no complaints. I found the room's lighting to be rather dim. There was cable TV. The bathroom was clean. And the back area of the hotel was very peaceful, there were no noise distubances. It helped that Denny's was connected to the hotel. I didn't have to go far to eat. Be sure to find out the departure times for the shuttle back to LAX, because it runs once an hour sometimes. I will stay here again for a layover.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Torontotraveller2088
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful place to stay when you need to catch a flight from LAX. The room was big and really nice with a balcony looking over a pool and a nice tropical garden. You couldn't hear the planes. The pool water was great. I was really happy with this place. Great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value and a great sleep”
Reviews.Author: AnnyZucchini
Reviews.Content: I stayed here based on other TripAdvisor reviews, after searching hard for a reasonably priced hotel close to the airport for a one night stay - I wanted somewhere safe as I'm an older woman travelling alone. The hotel is old, but has a great feel to it, not a high rise plastic place but low rise, round a funky pool. I had a room at the back, upstairs and I recommend asking for the back because it's very quiet away from the road, even with the windows open. The room was big, airy, comfortable, the bed was perfect and the whole place clean and easy going. Maybe the only drawback was struggling up a flight of stairs with my bag... The 24-hour Denny's on site was great, even though the food's not my style, but arriving late and having somewhere to eat was a real plus, as was the free 24-hour shuttle. The staff were helpful and polite and I was able to leave my bags there in secure storage all day for free, go sightseeing and get the free shuttle back to the airport late in the evening for an 11pm flight out. I really recommend this hotel for location, service and value.

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: lesreves
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in the travel lodge near lax on the night of august 20, 2008. We awoke with bits on our arms etc from bed bugs and found bed bugs in our luggage when we returned to canada. I sugges not staying at this motel until this problem is solved

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Thrifty_Traveller_7
Reviews.Content: This is not a brill hotel but clean if you want to stay just for a night before arriving or leaving LAX. The decor is dull & old fashioned but everything was clean & tidy. A free breakfast is available which is always good! Be warned you can wait up to an hour to be picked up or taken to the airport, as it is only an hourly shuttle service. However if you have planned for this it is not so bad. Better than amny of the hotel we saw on route.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel and one of my favorites.”
Reviews.Author: Timmy127
Reviews.Content: I think this is a great little hotel in LA. It is really cool and has an LA feel to it. The gardens are wonderful. It might not be the fanciest place. And a bit old, But it is like this little outdoor garden sanctuary in the LAX area. I really have fond memories and have stayed many times and would always go back. Like I say it is very "LA". Nice swimming pool andmaybe the service could be better or the class of the people. But I have never felt unsafe there. I would recommend it if you want the LA experience and are not a prude. Like I say it has nice gardens, cool plants all over and a great pool. Very LA style indeed. If not here I would stay at LAX Embassy suits south for a fancier hotel. But this hotel is a classic california hotel. And that is what many people are looking for when we go to LA. I want to feel LA energy and this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroach City!!”
Reviews.Author: zizisnake
Reviews.Content: While the hotel seemed to be clean, I was distracted by burn stains on the bed cover and when lying in bed, much to my dismay, discovered cockroaches the size of a cell phone ( I am not kidding!) crawling along the wall right under the ceiling. Also, the walls are paper thin and you can hear any conversation in the next room. Windows are only single paned and do not block out street noise from adjacent Sepulveda Blvd. You can hear every airplane taking off from LAX. I will never ever stay in that hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it”
Reviews.Author: Everglades22
Reviews.Content: I really hated this hotel. It seems it was some sort of community project turned into a hotel. I did not feel safe and it seemed dirty. Rooms were dark, beds uncomfortable, hollow floors (or wooden?). We saw what seemed to be escort ladies with their "manager". I barely got any sleep that night because I felt insecure and I was expecting to see roaches although I did no see one. There was a fee for using the Internet. Breakfast was served in a dark little room they opened in the morning. I did not dare eat it, it may have stayed there all night. Staff did their job but not very friendly. The only positive is that they have a shuttle service that picked us up at the car rental place close by. I will never stay there again. Pay a little more and stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Simple and spacious”
Reviews.Author: Dacquiri24
Reviews.Content: Siimple and basic is accurate, as well as the maze-like trudge to find the room. And it would have been nice to have been told when the free breakfast is offered. However, there are advantages: good free shuttle (haven't had a problem with this); hotel offers a day rate, which is great for when you have 7 hrs between flights; both times I've stayed there (2006 and 2008), the rooms have been very spacious; and there's a 24-hr Denny's restaurant adjacent to the hotel (mostly a breakfast place, but also sandwiches, salads, etc.). When I was there for a late supper at 11.30pm (friendly waintresses are happy to substitute salad if you don't want fries with everything), there were a couple of security guards conspicuously hanging out at the entrance (good or bad, depending on your point of view!).

Reviews.Title: “Decent Airport Motel”
Reviews.Author: DrRingDing
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 1 night in mid-May before an 8am flight out of LAX. The advantages of this hotel are the close proximity to rental car return facilities, stable wireless internet connection, and reasonable accommodations for the price. The disadvantage, in my experience, was the absence of insulation around the motel room door that made hallway noise clearly audible. Since this is an airport motel, I was awakened several times by late night guest arrivals and early morning guest departures. Signs are posted around the motel cautioning guests to be considerate of others, but this is apparently ineffective.

Reviews.Title: “Fit for purpose”
Reviews.Author: moo_mikey
Reviews.Content: Decent, quiet, clean rooms with efficient staff and reliable airport transfers. This is ideal for airport stops, either arriving late, leaving early or for a very short stay. You can check-in on to your flights from the 2 computers in reception and print out a boarding pass free of charge. Top tip when waiting for the bus to collect you from the airport, make your way to the first pick up point (far left as you come out of the terminal) as the bus soon gets full and you may struggle to find seating for the 5-10 min journey to the hotel when its busy. Only stop here to be near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Ruth87
Reviews.Content: The staff were unfriendly and acted like it was an effort to deal with us. There are only a few parking spaces or you park in the adjacent diner's car park. The room was right at the back of the property, a long way to carry suitcases. The whole place was very run down and worn and the room smelt. There was no double glazing on the windows which made it very noisy due to its proximity to the airport. At night there were people hanging around at the back of the building and it did not feel at all safe.

Reviews.Title: “quite good”
Reviews.Author: marzc
Reviews.Content: The place was clean and comfortable, and the staff friendly. The continental breakfast was adequate and very nice to start the day off. Location is pretty good, not too far from the beaches, Santa Monica, or even LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Airport Motel”
Reviews.Author: Simon1944
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here four or five times over the past ten or more years. It offers superb value for an airport hotel. The shuttle bus is quick and efficient. The rooms look dated but have everything you need. I requested a quiet room and got one. It was a long way from reception and there was no help with the luggage but I have no complaints. This is a simple, no frills motel - if that is what you are looking for - you will be happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Zee32
Reviews.Content: My wife, infant son, and I, stayed at the travelodge for 2 nights during a quick stay in Los Angeles. After reading some of the reviews here, I was a little apprehensive. This hotel was clean, a little tired, but overall was in nice shape. The price was excellent compared to others in the area, and we felt safe the entire time. We encountered no problems with noise, and found the service at the front desk to be satisfactory. It is a great place to stay for an extended layover, or to break up a trip, as we did. It's location is convenient to hit the major freeways, and we were able to find our way around quite easily. The staff was helpful in arranging for shuttles to and from the airport, and offered a shuttle to the rental car, but advised that I would be ok to walk as well. Overall, it is a great hotel for the money, and I would definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: mitchbtu
Reviews.Content: We Stayed for 9 days, 2 adults 3 children. Im not that picky and totally enjoyed the stay, and value for the money. My wife and daughter are somewhat pickier, and found the bed to be too hard for their liking. The room was clean, and we always felt very secure in the hotel. We very much enjoyed the shuttle, and used it to travel to many of the local restaraunts... Try the Thai food place on the hotel shuttle list. The food is fantastic, even tho the decor lacks. The breakfast is a bit chaotic, and we had trouble finding free tables sometimes. We did notice that the poolside tables were usually free, and made use of them mostly at breakfast. The car rental places across the road were very handy, and very reasonable. The staff at the hotel were as nice as pie, and always willing to answer all my questions. I would defiantely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “EEEEEKKKK or ICCCCKKKK”
Reviews.Author: mauilover0517
Reviews.Content: Why oh why didn't I check tripadvisor before I booked my hotel. This place truly is scary. I, a single woman, stayed here to make an early morning flight. I think sleeping on the floor at the ariport would have been nicer. Packed van only runs on the hour and half hour. Front desk swamped on checkin. Breakfast doesn't start til 6am so I missed out as I took the 6am van. (no sign up sheet for the van, 1st come 1st served, get there early!) There is a strip club 2 doors down and it's behind a gas station on a busy street. The only thing that would improve this place is a wrecking ball.

Reviews.Title: “Dated and nasty”
Reviews.Author: candyAustin
Reviews.Content: Both of our rooms smelled horribly and the place needs a serious update. There was "black stuff" in one of the showers. There is no elevator so we had to drag all our bags up and down the stairs. Never will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable prices, quiet, gardens and a pool”
Reviews.Author: niambh
Reviews.Content: We paid $59 to stay for the day between out connecting flight. We stayed at the Sheraton nearby on our outbound, and stayed at the Travelodge on our return. We called the motel from the airport after arrivals, and were picked up from the terminal in about 10 minutes by the free hotel shuttle. Check in took about three minutes, but we were also first in line - there was a line of about five people when we left check in. The motel is large, with multiple buildings. There is a pool and restaurant (Dennys) on site, the interior courtyard had a lot of plants and was generally very well maintained. The buildings themselves look very 70's, but kept clean and up to date. It took us about five minutes to get to our room, which was a regular room, but had a shower stall instead of a bathtub (don't know if this room is designated for short stays). The room was large, which I guess is normal in the West Coast. Very clean too. All in a clean, relaxed and quiet atmosphere perfect for familes with kids or toddlers. There is really no place to walk to from the motel, but if you are staying between flights or for a night, it really is a very nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Stay”
Reviews.Author: DukeFan91
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel in my Entertainment Book and booked it a rate of 80 dollars about 15 off the regular rate. The hotel is laid out very odd and it was difficult to find out room. We got in late after midnight and had to walk in and out of buildings to find our room and it felt a little unsafe in the dark. The room was okay. It had an weird odor that seemed to go away or I just got used to it. The bed was not the best. The bathroom looked like it had been updated with the last 5 years. The stay was just okay, the location is close to the airport, however, I would drive out an extra few miles and spend 40 bucks more for a nicer hotel. Parking is limited at this hotel and the spots are tiny...hope you rented a compact car! :)

Reviews.Title: “Yuk - bad service”
Reviews.Author: rison22990
Reviews.Content: Was given a single room when I booked for 2 people. Desk clerk would not correct the problem. We slept very crowded in a rather crummy room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: 5aussietravellers
Reviews.Content: Our family of five stayed here for one night after a long flight from Sydney before heading to Canada. We wanted a place to crash for the night to get the kids accustomed to a new time zone. From the airport the shuttle was great and extremely convenient. We arrived at the hotel where check-in was a breeze and were extremely pleased with the room. There were two queen beds and a requested single rollaway. The room was clean and provided everything we needed for our short stay. The kids wanted to go swimming so we grabbed some snacks and drinks and headed to the pool. The pool area was clean and secure and the kids had a blast. We walked down the road to Taco Bell for dinner, although I wouldn't recommend walking alone at night - not the safest area, although the hotel felt secure. The free included breakfast in the morning was fine, nothing spectacular - bagels with cream cheese, toast, cereal, hard boiled eggs on request, packaged pastries, and juice and coffee. The shuttle from the hotel was again adequate, taking less than five minutes to get to the airport. Service was fast and friendly, particularly the ladies in the hotel store and at breakfast. Would happily stay here again even for a longer period. The only complaint was the room was a bit crowded, but with five people and their luggage we would be better off booking a larger room should we stay longer, but for one night was well worth the price ($95.00). Traffic/airplane noise was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy travelodge”
Reviews.Author: berzerker007
Reviews.Content: Goods: Location Free breakfast (6-9, who wakes up at that time during vacation) Bads: really stinky rooms very dirty pool very uncomfortable beds Some rooms are underground and therefore very dark and stinky Way overrated

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find”
Reviews.Author: Ugurd
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight after arriving late to LAX. The cab driver had a hard time finding the hotel as it was situated a bit back from the street. It is quite close to the airport and gives good value for your money. The hotel is rather big with several houses and long corridors that are a bit spooky. Room was OK but nothing fancy. Breakfast was all-right too.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, restful, inexpensive & quiet!”
Reviews.Author: TravelPixels
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this hotel & loved it. There's a free shuttle from the airport, and the next morning I walked over & rented a car down the street at Budget. Save me taxi fare & a night of rental. Anyway, about the hotel. It's not new by any means, but it was clean, quiet & my king room was spacious. The bathroom was very clean & the shower was awesome - tall spout, hot shower & lots of water. The staff was courteous & the shuttle was timely. I sat out by the pool at night & watched the kids swim & felt safe. The gardens are beautiful and restful. It's like a mini forest in the middle of LA. I had no complaints whatsoever. It's not a luxury place, it's a family place. I had breakfast at the attached Denny's & went on my way the next morning with no issues. Am staying there again next month...

Reviews.Title: “Park & Fly with Retro Hollywood Character”
Reviews.Author: HikaruDragon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night for their park & fly package. Our room was an eclectic mix of old and new elements but still reminded me of old Hollywood with its cantilevered ceiling, faux bamboo headboard & mirror and pool surrounded by tropical plants. Tried to book the park & fly online but ended up having to call the motel directly. You drive your vehicle one block to the Parking Spot, a large covered garage, where the valet parks your car and moves all your luggage to their bright yellow vans with large black spots--easy to see amongst all the other airport shuttles. My husband used another hotel's park & fly before and said the Parking Spot was much more efficient, and their shuttles run every 5-10 minutes. If your hotel runs shuttles less frequently, you may also be waiting longer to get on a shuttle that has space on it for you and your bags. Although this motel is noisy because it is close to the airport, it also saves you the anxiety of having to battle the ever-present L. A. traffic to get to the airport on time for your flight. Just turning right out of the motel parking lot to drive one block took several minutes because of the traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Low Cost Overnighter”
Reviews.Author: PVJennybean
Reviews.Content: Stayed here bookending a trip to Mexico, on July 31 and again August 8. Easy quick check in, prompt friendly staff. Chose this hotel because of price, reviews and proximity to LAX, as well as free shuttle. Shuttle service was prompt, free breakfast was what you would expect from a free breakfast (not a huge selection but much better than other continental offerings I've seen)...it was fresh and the breakfast buffet was well kept and clean; it filled the gap, and was a big improvement over the offerings at LAX. If you're looking at a long term stay this probably wouldn't be the hotel I would choose, but for an overnight before or after a flight or even a couple of nights, it filled the bill. Hint - opt for the non-smoking standard or superior king size rooms. They are located in the back of the property and are very quiet. Not huge but clean, good beds and you don't hear a single thing from the nearby airport. I stayed in 160 and 172 - 172 was the better room. The rooms in the back building also have beautiful foliage lined pathways. I'd use this hotel again for an overnight if I needed to.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, Average staff”
Reviews.Author: azzurrii
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at Travelodge. Chose it over others because of price and its close proximity to LAX. First contact with the hotel personnel was a staff at the front desk during check-in. Had quite a poor first impression cos the body language of that particular staff suggested he wasn't really interested in serving the guest. That aside, cos not all of them were like him. The room i stayed in was excellent in my opinion. Beds were clean and furnishing was adequate. And despite it being located next to a main road, I didn't find the room noisy at any time. In a nutshell, I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a comfortable place to stay in, which is also near the airport. However, don't expect excellent treatment from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “One more vote to avoid this place like the plague”
Reviews.Author: tanaval
Reviews.Content: I arranged for customers to stay here and guaranteed the rooms with my credit card only to get a call in the middle of the night EST telling me the customers have to pay for the room themselves unless I can send a fax. WEll, since I was in the middle of nowhere and unable to send a fax my customers had to pay for their rooms. Had I been told this, it would have been taken care of and the person on the phone acted like this is perfectly normal, to guarantee a room but be unable to pay for the room with the card guaranteeing the room. No wonder Holiday Inn mops the floor with Travelodge, what a ridiculous attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Place”
Reviews.Author: Pottery_House
Reviews.Content: After a very long days driving we where looking for a reasonable place to stay for the night, before heading into LA the next day. We saw Travelodge and thought that would be reasonably priced and good accommodation. How wrong we were. Although it was cheap it was the most awful place I've ever stayed. Constant traffic noice from the nearby main road, other guests shouting to each other on the balcony at 5am, staff curt to the point of insolance, bathroom in bad need of renovation. We went down to breakfast at 9am to find it was all being cleared away, mind you what there was didn't look very appetising, wrapped pastries, watered down orange and terrible coffee. The only good points where that the bedroom was reasonably clean and had a nice big bed.

Reviews.Title: “Average but very good location”
Reviews.Author: RanyDanny
Reviews.Content: This is a budget airport hotel that I used on a late night/early morning plane change in LAX. The hotel is very well located clse to the Airport. There is a Denny's on the premises which is a very good feature for late night or early morning departures. The rooms are big and clean. However the layout of the hotel is very weird and it is a complete adventure to find or get out of your room.

Reviews.Title: “They do not give true info”
Reviews.Author: openzin
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel for one night before an afternoon flight and wanted to have some work done. At the reservation they said they have free Internet (it's exactly that I needed for the work) and I should not have any problems with little late check out at 1-2 PM (normally they do it at noon). In reality it appears that I did not have any Internet connection from my room (maybe it's working in another rooms which I doubt because even outside it's very unstable, but my laptop has very good sensitivity). Also at the next day they said that no any late checkout... How one could believe them? At least definitely do not trust in their "free" Internet. Only one postive moment, they provided a shutle to airport :)

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back again!”
Reviews.Author: rarebird
Reviews.Content: Over the yeas we have stayed here many times and not had a problem. Granted, the rooms are nothing special but you get what you pay for. This year was a totally different experience. Earlier in our vacation, I had hurt my ankle and was having a great deal of trouble walking. At check-in, we asked if it would be possible to have a room near the front. The clerk was very rude and said that it would cost an extra $10. In the past, we have often stayed up front by the pool and have never requested that! We decided to decline the extra charge so she assigned us to a room about as far back as you can go....No. 168. Well, guess what, that room was already occupied. We opened the door and there was luggage, clothing and obvious signs that people were staying there. After another long trek to the desk, we were given room #170. All in all in was a pretty poor way to end a vacation. The only thing this place has going for it, is the nice landscaping and good shuttle service. After getting in touch with the manager and getting a snotty response, we will not be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Come on, price & location are perfect!”
Reviews.Author: tripper3000
Reviews.Content: I'm sitting here using the free WiFi looking out over my balcony at the pool. Nice cosy feel for the price during the day, lots of palms and outdoor seating that reminds a little of a backpackers or something like that. Room has a charm not often seen in places this cheap. It's all a bit creaky old school, but nice - they give you a nice wooden table and nice chair, nice bedside tables, the bed is massive, in fact the whole room is generous in size. It's little extras that count such as the big TV, loads of movies on demand, comfortable lounge chair, mirror, etc. The key thing here is that it's dirt cheap at $90 US inc tax, right next to the airport, and there's a 24-hour Dennys restaurant as part of the complex - so food all time of the day without needing to venture far. If all you want to do is chill out one day at the airport to get your next flight, this has got to be it. I previously also stayed at the Hacienda, which has a few more bars and things in the area, but it was about $20 more expensive and about 10 minutes further away. Although also decent, so check that out as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good priced accommodation at LAX”
Reviews.Author: dandaman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the way to a flight to Europe. Check in went well, and had an adequate room. The property was very 60s Southern California, with lots of tropical plants around the pool area -- a nice place to hang out. There was a Denny's on site which we frequented several times to kill some time. Not quite a nice neighborhood, but it was right next to LAX and the free shuttle worked well. Continental breakfast was satisfactory, and loads of people were eating it outside at 6am since there's no indoor breakfast room. Paid a good rate, and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “LAX very secure Travel Lodge”
Reviews.Author: JohnandMonica
Reviews.Content: Having waited 45 minutes for the Courtesy Bus at 10pm was not the best start to staying at this Hotel. The lady on reception was very efficient and sent us to a room at the furthest point. The room was reasonable for the money we paid, the musty smell must have been free. We were hungry so ventured into Denny's Diner, which at 11.30pm was not the most welcoming of eateries, however some of the food was eatable and the Beer helped. The Bed was not the most comfortable, however at 12.30am who cares. Breakfast was a little chaotic, a little room with a lot of people trying to select some food and then having to find somewhere to eat it. The return Courtesy Bus was on time, if a little over-full. This was a very secure Hotel, apart from a very large Security Officer, who must have felt quite safe as the place is surrounded with high wire fences, resembles a prison. It's an OK Hotel for an overnight at LAX, as long as the Courtesy Bus picks you up.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: TravelnutCapeCoral
Reviews.Content: Great 24 Hours Free Shuttle Service to Airport-Fast pick up & delivery. Wonderful older Hotel but close to Airport. Denny's on site and attached to Hotel...clean quiet room, pretty grounds and pool...very helpful staff....a joy to spend the transitional night at. Free Shuttle in evening to a list of restaurants. Not a walking area but felt very safe.

Reviews.Title: “cheap basic accomodation”
Reviews.Author: D4T4
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night after a long flight from the UK. The shuttle collected us from airport with no difficulty (there was only two of us) and check in went smoothly. The room was a good size and clean. There was a notice about ants and we did see a couple in the shower but other than that the room was fine. We did have to climb stairs to get to our room so ask for a ground floor room if this is a problem. The pool looked nice although we didnt use it, the grounds were very tropical. The area the hotel was in was'nt the most up market. Breakfast, a bit chaotic and very basic. There is a Dennys next door but we stuck with the free breakfast! The shuttle also dropped us at our car rental place in the morning which was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Pack your earplugs & flannel pjs”
Reviews.Author: LaConnerLady
Reviews.Content: Our party of 4 arrived at the hotel at 9:45 pm on Feb 26 after waiting 40 minutes for the shuttle at LAX. The hotel staff were effecient upon check-in and the lobby was attractive. However the rest of our lodging experience was unpleasant. The hallways leading to the adjoining rooms were littered with trash (luggage tags, take-away cups, plastic wrappers) and the rooms unpleasantly lit and poorly heated. One room had not been cleaned and we were moved to a different wing from our traveling partners. Both room's heaters made a loud metal-on-metal noise when turned on and had to be turned off to allow for sleeping, resulting in a very cold room by morning. We listened to the TV in a neighboring room all night long and the noise from people pulling luggage down the hallway was very loud starting at 4:00 AM. We had an early morning flight and used the 5:00 am shuttle which departed promptly and arrived at the terminal in a timely fashion. However, there were far more guests than the shuttle could safely accommodate forcing several guests to sit on the laps of others and some to stand in the doorway. We had heard others registering their plans to use the early shuttle with the staff and were surprised that no one had arranged to deploy the second van parked out front.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, terrible staff”
Reviews.Author: bellapreciosa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had just come from our honeymoon and wanted an inexpensive place to stay the night that was close to the airport and offered breakfast. When we arrived we used the courtesy phone to call the shuttle and the woman assured us that they would be there shortly. An hour later (and after I called again to see where it was) the shuttle arrived. Now, the shuttle fit 8 people I believe, and there about 15 waiting for it. How did the driver solve the problem? He told everyone to get in and sit on each other's laps! I was appalled! Can you say accident waiting to happen? When we finally arrived at the hotel, the woman at the desk was very unfriendly, teetering on rude (way to damper our spirits!) The room was fine, everything was clean, and we slept ok. But then we got up to have "breakfast." "Breakfast" was served in a tiny room, with one very exasperated and rude woman working the behind the counter. She hurredly asked for what we wanted, barely bothered to wait for a response, and then gave us the wrong food! And the order choices were hardly difficult to remember: Plain or raisin bagel (toasted?), egg?. Also, there were only two tables to sit at, and about 50 people there to eat breakfast so we had to either go back to our room (a 5 mninute walk) or sit on someone's patio. It was very uncomfortable. Overall, the room and price were fine, but the service is lacking and the (evening) staff was below par.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: BeatriceNY
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel if you want a good night sleep. Mattresses are old & feels like you are sleeping on a box spring. Weird layout. Creepy shower. Only good thing was shuttle to the airport, which most hotels at LAX probably provide. Free breakfast was not bad either.

Reviews.Title: “No Parking!!!”
Reviews.Author: AAAAgent
Reviews.Content: If you have a car that needs a safe parking place- forget this motel. They have maybe 10 spaces that are in a secure area. The rest of the parking (in the alley, or the driveway) is scary. The hotel itself is SCARY. I never made it to my room, the motel was frightening. The front desk people were rudde, and did not want to refund my deposit- even though it was 1pm and i had the option of canceling until 6pm. The Motel 6 down the strreet would be a much better choice.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: anemonefish
Reviews.Content: This inexpensive motel has a funky charm. The staff is obviously trying to convert an older property into something pleasant and useful. By and large, they are succeeding. Free WiFi, nice continental breakfast, and live plants in rooms and the garden-like interior grounds. Obviously predating the high rise hotels that fill the neighborhood, the Travelodge offers a surprisingly nice refuge in a hectic area. Only minutes from the LAX front door. Those expecting VIP amenities (and corresponding prices) should look elsewhere - there are plenty of 3-5 times costlier venues within easy walking distance. But those willing to look past a tough veneer will find a nice place that's not just canned, shrink-wrapped, or franchised out of any sense of individuality or uniqueness.

HotelInfo.Name: Travelodge Hotel at LAX
HotelInfo.Address: 5547 W. Century Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90045
